reviews.review: Great way to experience the city. We took a canal cruise in a small boat... less than 8 people. It was more intimate and allowed access into some of the smaller neighborhoods. Our company was Open Boat tours, the captain/ guide was very good.

Fabulous. We took a canal cruise our first morning in town. I highly recommend it to get the lay of the land or canal. Later we went back and walked around. We always felt safe. Lots of people wondering around. Careful of the bikes.
Beautiful and tranquil. This is one of the nicest churches in the city centre. Walking along the Prinsengracht we always have a look if De Duif is open, because the architecture is beautiful.

Scenic, beautiful area of canals. I would highly recommend Prinsengracht as a great canal to walk around and to admire the architecture, watch the bikes go whizzing by and take in a few shops and bars.
Not unlike the Jordaan. You just need 20 minutes to stroll through. Quite, classy, very elegant and pretty area. Must be nice to live here! Not a critical stop but if you are in the area.........

Nice canal cruise. It is nice canal cruise in the afternoon and makes you sleepy as we cruise along. It is interesting to see all the buildings along the canal. Impressive how the busy the canals are and trees and flowers are everywhere. We get to see a lot of buildings, houses, church and so on in this cruise. Beautiful!

Canals with Well designed bank and precinct. This is the main beauty of Amsterdam. Very well maintained canals are there with well designed and colorful bank and precinct. One can have cycle ride or boat ride.

Very nice canal.. There are lots of canals in Amsterdam.This is oner of the nicest, The buildings on either side of the canal are old and impressive. A boat ride through this canal and other canals is a nice thing to do.

Beautiful structure.. Located in the area of Magere Brug is this former Roman Catholic Church. It has been renovated; from the outside is is neo Barogue, but the inside is stunning. The acoustics are great. It is primarily rented out for special functions: weddings and musical productions. A great place to see.

Canal along Prinsengracht. This canal and street are one of the outer rings of Amsterdam. The architecture style is a little different, more mixes of styles, and warehouses now converted to cafes and hotel. Its an interesting mix, and good to stroll on a sunny day. Anne Frank museum is on this street, so if you have some time you can walk to the museum along the canal.

De Duif is a mainstay tourist stop which can be passed through or avoided. While it is peaceful, there are many locations around many of the canals which provide a similar ambience. If in the area, why not enjoy it? But, I wouldn't recommend going out of the way, as one can find this "scene" in and around most of the canals.
View from a canal in Amsterdam. View from a canal in Amsterdam, Nice experience, do not miss it, free Amsterdam card, There are many stops

Very nice spot to visit. Very nice inland waterway. Picturesque and quiet. One of the places you can duck away to and lose the crowds. Easy walking distances and friendly people to watch and say hello to.

Yes, the typical and expected picture of Amsterdam. you see the typical and expected picture of Amsterdam. it is hectic arround this area: pedestrian, cylists, motorcyclists. Then this nearby picture of silcend under the streed - the Gracht. This is exactly why we are going here.

must go. De Duif is On the opposite site of the canal one has a good view off this building. It is a monument
we felt this is a very good place to view
every one

Beautiful. Right next to Jordaan, this quiet Canal area offers one a great venue for strolling. It is close to Anne Frank House where one can make it a past time to watch lines wait in line and snaking to visit the attraction and Westkerk. Many visitors stop to take photos as they shop, stop to relax and have a coffee and snacks. Shopping can be costly.

Other canals are nice a s well. I live on the prinsengracht and in my neighbourhood it is very crowded with locals,and tourists. I love the prinsengracht but the keizersgracht, herengracht, single and all the other canals are nice too! Spread out a little bit. And please don't walk side by side in the middle of the road. On the other hand: it is close to the jordaan, the Anne frank house is on the prinsengracht (look on the Internet to order tickets instead of waiting for hours on the street. Why spend your time in Amsterdam waiting? Same for some museums!) enjoy!

Ride bike!. Do not miss to ride a bike to visit every corner of street in the downtown. Biking is the easiest way can reach everywhere than to take boat. Lovely city and nice people with great beers. Suggest visit time will be in April or May. It's worth to pay 2nd visit or 3rd visit.

Canal Fascinating Still Today. A canal ride is not to be missed in Amsterdam. Pick a sunny day, as the tops of the ceiling are windows and there are two areas for vantage points outside the seating areas. Take the Orange boat which stops at many places.

Beautiful streets. We stayed in an apartment on Prinsengracht while in Amsterdam, and absolutely loved the neighborhood. It's only a few blocks away from the very touristy areas, but you feel like you're a world away. Very much worth walking through on a nice day.

Beautiful Canal Area. We twice dined canal-side on the Prinsengrach. On one of our two visits, a jazz band played on a platform on the water, just a block away from the Anne Frank House. Quite possibly the nicest canal area in Amsterdam. The gift shop at the Tulip Museum had some nice items for souvenir shoppers.

My favorite area of Amsterdam. This is my favorite part of Amsterdam. Well, this and Jordaan which is right next to it. Great small antique stores, design stores, independent clothing stores, etc. No large chain places. No large groups of partiers. Fewer crowds. Laid back feel but very hip area. Stayed at the Andaz on Prinsengracht which was perfect.

Camera snapping. Such a pretty canal to walk along, the water on one side with houseboats and flowering potted plants and typical Amsterdam homes with window boxes, ivy covered walls on the other. Plenty of places to stop and eat and drink and enjoy life. Did stop at a few shops and found them ridiculously dear.

Do it sitting down!. A canal cruise is really the best way to take in the canals. You can sit back and enjoy the view rather than doing it on foot…walking around gazing everywhere and risking a collision with one of Amsterdam's many crazy speeding cyclists. The glass roofed canal boats can make photography a bit difficult, so be aware of reflection off the glass if you're planning on taking photographs. You're also down pretty low on the canals so much of the view is the building fronts.The commentary provided by the canal boat operators in English is informative and occasionally droll. The routes are planned to take in particularly unique points of interest, such as the narrowest house and explanations of the many types of gable style.Prinsengracht, Kaisersgracht and Herengracht are the great canals of Amsterdam - a must-see, but the city should be cautioned…two former Amsterdammers remembered Centrum differently, observing that Amsterdam has become a dirty city - with a lot of cigarette butts littered between the footpath flagstones and wrappers and food scraps littered everywhere. Drink cans and rubbish was noted floating in the canal. Spitting on the street appears to have become a 'new fashion.'
Lovely area to walk. Lovely way to explore Amsterdam by walking along its beautiful canals. Another way to get a feel for the city is to take one of the many canal cruises.
Scenic. A lovely part of the city, the canal and the quaint buildings look charming, especially if the sun is shining. Take a stroll and enjoy the city.

Beautiful and delicious. I stayed in a hotel nearby and loved wandering the streets nearby. I found great iced coffee and green juices, tasty lunches, and cute shops. The best part was just wandering the canals and taking it all in.

Wonderful canal. This canal hosts some of the best examples of canal houses and varied gables in Amsterdam. Well worth the walk or canal boat tour. Or you can stay at Eric's B&B #667 and live the life.
Lovely Way To Spend An Hour Or So. We took a canal trip to this lovely area of the city. Stop and get off and wander about and visit a bar or cafe. You won't be disappointed.
Pretty,. Probably best seen from a boat , then pop out, walk around and stop for a coffee and cake. Lovely area in s great city. Don't miss

Relax by the canal. One of the 3 canals dug in the 17th century, it forms a concentric ring around the city. Nearby is several art centres such as Anne Frank House. Best to appreciate from the water, ie take a boat ride, then sit outside a cafe and just relax.

So beautiful. When in Amsterdam, make sure you spend some time wandering up and down Prinsengracht. The buildings are beautiful and I had to stop myself from being too nosy and staring in at people in their amazing homes!
lovely. a really lovely hotel,we found the staff really helpful and very friendly,the rooms were very comfortable and clean and tidy
Nice, quiet canal area. The Prinsengracht is a nice, quiet canal area. It is where the Anne Frank House is located. It is a nice area for a peaceful walk.

Far from the madding crowd. Rented an Airbnb here the apartment was spacious, filled with light and had a large bay window with a panoramic view of the canal we had a great coffee shop/gallery below us and a brown cafe on the corner the neighbourhood was quiet and relaxed it felt a thousand miles away from the bustle of the more tourist areas.

Zomaar. A city walk through Amsterdam brings you in a short time to this spot in Amsterdam.
From the Central Station you an also take the " tram " to this beatyfull place.

great place to relax and see the city. we walked all around this canal and we found it charming, the houses around especialy at evening time gives it a romantic look and a beutiful place to feel Amsterdam

The Prince's Canal. The Prinsengraght, or Prince's Canal, is named after Prince William of Orange and was one of 3 canals dug in the 17th century to form a ring around the city centre.The best way to appreciate all the canals is from the water. Here you will see many tall and narrow homes lining the canal on both sides all with characteristic hoist beams which were used for bringing in large furniture items. Since the houses are so narrow the people could not bring in anything large up the staircases, and so had to hoist large furniture straight in through the windows. Moored alongside the canal are many flowed bedecked houseboats which are permanent homes for many people.
Water water water. We did it by boat, it is really worth it. All those old but beautiful houses along the canal are amazing. You need to take your time to visit this.

Nice canal. Best enjoyed from the water, this is one of the larger canals in Amsterdam.The many boat tours all go along here and mostly they provide a commentary on the history of the canal which is really essential if you want to pick out all the architectural, technical, social and historic features of the canal and its environs.

Great atmosphere!. Very Nice to stroll along the Canal and watch all the great old buildings With their indiviual details or do some Windows shopping or have a bite somewhere. It is a very charming area of Amsterdam!

Best apple pie in Amsterdam. Bill Clinton is apparently a big fan of the apple pie at Café Papeneiland on Prinsengracht. A lovely street with plenty of cafés and attractions, definitely worth a visit if you're in the Jordaan district. We love walking around and exploring on our own.

Beautiful Area of Amsterdam. The Canal House we rented was on Prinsengracht so we had the amazing gift each morning and night of looking down on this wonderful canal and enjoying all of the others doing the same in their boats. Cocktail parties in the rain do not stop - umbrellas come out and the party continues. This area of Amsterdam is in the art and antique area as well as being close to the Reikmuseum, Museumplein, Van Gogh/etc. Anne Frank is also on this street. Many art galleries and interesting stores on both sides made walks along the canal that much more interesting.

Great location for visitors. The third outer ring of canals, we stayed here for a week and the location is great. Tram lines intersect it so you are just minutes from Centraal station. The Rijksmuseum is also minutes away if you are in the central area. This area is also full of nightlife and restaurants. Of course, Anne Frank's house is here as well.Walking one way along the canal, you find Jordaan, the other way is the zoo; both areas have a neat yet distinct feel.The canal is generally busy with small recreational boats.Early morning people will find they are the only ones awake sine the area (and Amsterdam) wakes late.I'd recommend the area as a place to stay.
Love Amsterdam. Nice walks over the bridges on the grachten. In Amsterdam you have to walk on the bridges and make the famous selfies overlooking the grachten on the back.
Beautiful. Spend a nice sunny day at prinsengrachtEat and shop , walk along the canal , and just relaxYou can walk from Central Station and also take a tram there
lovely. pretty part of the canal strip easy to get to and contains attractions such as the anne frank house. we went past here on our canal cruise and found out some interesting facts

Beautiful Weather for Once. My wife and I have visited this area of Amsterdam quite a few times over the years in May, June, September or October. Every time the weather has been terrible with wind and rain or overcast sky. But one Sunday afternoon early last June on the day that we arrived from the USA the weather was perfect! Sunny blue sky and very warm weather. It made a big difference in our enjoyment of the city.

Quieter Canaal, more impressive Company and elite esidences. Go off the main streets of Amsterdam and go to each Canaal side and walk around it. Many cafes, bars, small places to eat dinner, it is where the Dutch residents go.

Favorite canal to stay on. Love this canal - stay at Hotel Pulitzer - walk to great restaurants, cafe, local key attractions and the Jordaan. Charing, great people watching, strolling, shopping and photo opps galore.

Nice canals. The weather was not ideal when i was there 2 weeks ago but I can see the appeal of the canals. Prinsengracht is one of the main rings and has some of the prettiest intersections. Try to wait for nightfall when some of the lights were lit up.

Nice area for a fun walk when it does not rain. I am a regular in Amsterdam and still discover new details when I walk with friends in the ages old streets along canals. There is plenty to see, discover, shop, eat or drink wherever you go.

something interesting to see everywhere you look. we spent around 4 days in Amsterdam last week in very soggy conditions. It's a walking city and walk we did. You don't really come here for brilliant sunshine and heat and it didn't put us off. Just get out there and walk around... look in all the little nooks and crannies, into beautiful courtyards and splendidly decorated houses (yes, I did feel a bit rude when I couldn't help peeking into someone's gorgeous front room - the windows are quite large)... and when you need a break there are a myriad little cafes and coffeeshops to cater to whatever you fancy

Great Architecture. A very lovey part of Amsterdam, with plenty to see and do. A nice change away from the central hubbub of downtown Amsterdam south of the train station. The area is home to the Anne Frank House, The Westerkerk Church and the Anne Frank Statue. It’s relaxing to ride in a canal taxi through the area. The architecture here is stunning and most of it dates back to the 16th and 17th centuries.

Stayed on a magnificent houseboat on this canal. Had an amazing experience staying on a houseboat on the Prinsengracht Canal - spent an afternoon sitting on the top deck watching the boats and tourists go by - highly recommended
Delightful . This neighborhood that follows along a fabulous canal has so many upscale homes, it would be a mistake not to take pics and leisurely stroll the area.

Beautiful. Amazing time, breath taking every step of the way. I would recommend a pedal boat for a thorough canal experience. Decent price for an hour (I believe 8€ per person and a refundable 20€ deposit at one of the kiosks. The name escapes me.

Rain,Hail or Shine......You're Sure to have a Great Time. This is about getting the feel of a city, sure there are tourists about but it's not down town tourist central. Eat, drink, wander photograph, shop but over all just soak it all up...so much to appease the senses.Stop for a coffee, wander the streets, cross the bridges and admire the stunning architecture of this locale, have a beer, stop for lunch better yet for dinner it oozes charm, it opens it's arms and welcomes you, canals cris cross it but how ever you visit it you're sure to be taken in by it......
A truly great canal. This is a great canal. There are lots of great sights - especially the houses. This is an amazing canal to walk along and take in the sights

Good for seeing historical classic Dutch architecture.. Good for seeing historical classic Dutch architecture. Grand canal houses, along with the Nine Streets" shopping area. See also the Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht canals.

Lucked Out. When I booked a hotel on the "Prinsengracht", I had no idea of what or where it was. All I knew was that it was a canal in Amsterdam. First, it is beautiful, day or night. You get to see the hustle and bustle of the city along this canal. Between bicycles, which have the right-of-way, lots of pedestrians, and a few cars, there is always some activity. Secondly, it is a great location to walk to almost anything, close to lots of museums (including one of my favorites, the Anne Frank House), shops, and many restaurants and bars. The houseboats which line the canal give the Prinsengracht a special charm. Most of the houseboats are permanently anchored along the canal. Each has a unique décor reflecting the owner's taste and/or sometimes humor. When we return to Amsterdam, we will definitely stay on the Prinsengracht again. Depending on your stamina, you could spend hours walking along the canal, stopping for a cup of coffee or beer, and enjoying watching the people. Although I wouldn't recommend it for a rainy day, if you've got an umbrella or rain poncho, then why not? It rained one day while we were in Amsterdam, and the pedestrian traffic along the Prinsengracht didn't seem to be affected.
fantastic area. great are and next to the centre. fantastic bars, restaurants, we stayed on houseboat so would recommend

One more gorgeous stretch of canal. This is one of the most romantic and beautiful stretch of the many nice canals in Amsterdam. You will pass through this area with several tours and it is worth doing it many times! It is also nice to walk around and take some pictures standing in one of the bridges around this area.

A great canal to stay on. My mom and I stayed in a house boat on the Prinsengracht canal. There are so many bars and restaurants along the canal and it is never a dull moment. I highly recommend the visit and even staying along this canal.

Enjoyed all of it !!. The variety of canal house boats gives you a good flavor for Prisengracht, including that gorgeous church of Westerkerk . That church steeple is so impressive that I kept taking pictures of it from several angles and later bought a print of it around the Rijksmuseum.To us, it was the most picturesque street in Amsterdam!
Lovely area . We enjoyed walking around this area. Lots of cafes, restaurants, shops and beautiful old buildings to admire. The architecture is amazing.
Gotgeous. It is a beautiful and charming place. There is plenty to do with the Anne Frank house, and of course the cheese museum. Pleasant and easy to get around.
Picture perfect. We recently stayed here in an apartment called petit prince and it was just amazing, this part of amsterdam is very pretty with lovely canals and little shops to visit.
Canals are Amsterdam. We went on this as part of an canal tour organised by our bed and breakfast. It is wonderfull and the canals are very historically interesting

Canals, canals, canals. Having taken two guided tours of the canals and one evening cruise of the canals over a three day period, the Prinesengracht provided a beautiful example of the hand dug canals of the city and the beautiful, historic buildings built along it.

A Beautiful and Quiet Area that Is A Must See. We had a layover in Amsterdam overnight on our way home from Rome to NYC. I did not want to waste the opportunity to at least experience some of Amsterdam before our flight the next morning. So we took a taxi into town and asked the driver what we must see in the short time we had to visit. Without hesitating he said, "Prinsengracht." I told him, okay. Take us there. It was ten o'clock at night, but the area along the canal was still hoping. But it wasn't loud and over crowded. It was quiet and beautiful. Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants to explore and we walked into almost all of them before settling on "Gespot" but that's left to another review. The canal banks are lined with hidden shops, cafes, houseboats and of course the inevitable bikes. Canal cruise boats are constantly passing along with the smaller vessels. Life revolves around all of the canals. The architecture along the canal is very varied, including the odd rooftop garden? Just breathtaking. It's a must see.

Lots of Restaurants and close to Anne Frank House. We came here for lunch one day after visiting the Anne Frank House and came back again in the evening to try the Pancake Bakery. There are a lot of restaurants in this area and the walk is very lovely.
Must see being in Amsterdam!. One of the famous Amsterdam canals. This part of the city is really beautiful and everyone should at least once take a walk of it.
Canal side walks. It is so peaceful, especially early on a Sunday morning when there's not many people about, to wander along the canal side streets.

The real feeling in Amsterdam. Walking on the side of the cannal on Prinsengracht gives you that true feeling one has when visiting Amsterdam. The nice views, the water chillness, the combination of typical buildings & water gave us the best feeling we could experience in this city,
Lovely!!. One of the Canals/Streets that runs right the way around the city. It's beautiful, and peaceful all the way around.
this is Amsterdam. I think this is the best area to see the real Amsterdam. The canal, the houses and the people. Whether it's day or night, I think it's a beautiful place. Loved it.

Quaint area, with good cafes and boutique shops. This canal was the main area to get to every other part of the City. There were nice restaurants and cafes to sit and watch the world go by. Great ice cream parlour - look out for the long queue outside!!
Classy and peaceful. Our hotel was there and this place was so nice and calm. There is lots of restaurants and design shops in the street and nearby. Get lost between the canals and have fun :)

Beautiful and tranquil. I like walking around Prinsengracht best when it is dark. It is exciting to see all the houses with their lights on and see the people inside. I love the reflections on the water. The side streets off Prinsengracht are filled with boutiques and restaurants. It is lovely not to hear traffic. It is really beautiful and peaceful.
Great for a quiet walk. We stayed in a hotel in this canal so we walked along many times. It was a lovely quiet walk which made it easy to get from one site to another

A glorious canalside experience. Like all the Amsterdam canals, delightful in its views, adjoining buildings, restaurants and cafe's, and busy cycle lanes; not to mention all the boating activity on the water. On a sunny day, a wonderful place to pass the time, either strolling or sitting.

Romance in the Air... ,. Awww... Missing this place so very much. Just the name sends me to the best time I have had in my life. It feels like you are Dream- Walking into Paradise. What else does a human need to live for? Peace n Serenity n Loven Fresh Air n Beauty n Happiness... All in one place... Amsterdam. This street is rt next to the canal and is circumscribing the city almost. A very beautiful place to click pics and have fond memories.
Canal walk. Lovely walking along the canal towards Anne Frank's house! Be careful of the bikes and cars on the cobbled paths! Lovely bars and shops to break up your walk!

I saw it 3 times. For a variety of reasons, I walked it twice and saw it by canal boat. An attractive walk with shops, cafes, houseboats, flowers. Stop and light a candle (in a Protestant church!) at Westerkerk. Buy a souvenir at the Tulip Museum. Make a reservation and honor Anne Frank and all she stands for. Enjoy a little quiet.
very pretty canal. Just wander along the canal, crossing the bridges occasionally. The views are beautiful, and from time to time you may find a bench.
The "coziest" canal. Please help keep our city clean: f you bring food or beverages, please toss empty containers in the garbage bins. Do not leave them in the street. Now enjoy.

A stroll through Amsterdam. Prinsengracht (Prince's Canal) is the fourth and the longest of the main canals in Amsterdam. It is named after the Prince of Orange. Most of the canal houses along it were built during the Dutch Golden Age of the United Provinces. Notable buildings along Prinsengracht include the Noorderkerk (Northern Church), the Noordermarkt (Northern Market), Anne Frank House, and the Westerkerk (Western Church, Amsterdam's tallest church). I truly recomend for a walk through any time of day.
Beautiful sunny day to enjoy. spent a couple of days wending our way along the canals. Lots to see, lots of stops, and constant information to take in.
Beautiful. A beautiful part of Amsterdam, a hidden treasure is close by - a "brown bar" which are traditional Dutch bars filled with locals and good beer

A fun place to wander. An enjoyable place to wander with the canal, the boats of different types, the houses and their unique shape and leanings.
Makes for a relaxing stroll.

Lovely canal to stroll by. My favorite activity in Amsterdam was walking along this and the Herengracht canals. Quiet in places and very scenic. so many interesting buildings to look at. Take a few hours and walk along these canals while you're in Amsterdam.

any canal tour must include the Prinsengracht. this is also where you'll pass the Anne Frank House or choose it as a starting point for your canal tour which is simply one of the must do's in Amsterdam. You pass some of the loveliest old houses anywhere and the tour operator will speak in English and Dutch about what you see (that way you don't miss anything of importance).

Beautiful. Beautiful area to wander around - the buildings and boats are great to look at. Lots of interesting shops and cafes too. Only downside is the number of bikes, mopeds and trams to watch out for, especially if you have children. Stick to the little roads...

Beautiful. Worth the time to stroll and take it all in. Take a few moments to sit on the benches canal-side or at a cafe enjoying a beverage. Early evening, with the setting sun, seems to be a magical time.
Beautiful and atmospheric. We stayed on a houseboat on this canal and could have simply sat for hours watching the world go by.
A beautiful canal. We loved walking along the canal and stopping for a coffee or glass of wine watching the world go by. We found everyone very friendly and helpful.
Beautiful. Prinsengracht is one of the most beautiful streets in Amsterdam... Bridge after bridge over the canal and a lovely walk...
Take the Canal tour. We did the drop on and off canal tour of Prinsengracht. It is a beautiful canal filled with historic buildings. A must to see!
Great street for shopping. Prinsengracht is one of the prettiest streets in Amsterdam. There are a lot of nice shops and restaurants plus attractions like Anne Frank House and the Tulip Museum.
Pretty canal. Take a walk along this canal as Anne Franks Huis (house) is on it and if its sunny lots of people sit along it and talk and have picnics in the sunshine. Beautiful

A superb canal. We stayed at a hotel (The Hotel Amsterdam Weichmann) for 5 days (4 nights) on this road and it is a wonderful canal. It has an excellent restaurant (Van Puffelen) as well as Anne Frank's House and is an ideal place to stay just outside the main centraal area.

An excellent walk. Once you discover Prinsengracht you should walk around and spend some money visiting each of the the attractions. There are some lovely places to eat, museums and shops and you can easily spend most of your holiday budget on one street!
Posh. One of the poshest location in Amsterdam. Famous Anne Frank House is situated here. One can notice a good architecture works here.
About as Amsterdamian as it gets. Take a stroll on a Sunday morning. Nothing is open and nobody is around. Which just adds to the charm and comfort of this delightful canal.

weekend visit. A tour of the canals is a must for any visit to Amsterdam. they can be taken from the Damrak and last about an hour. You get to see all the main canals and get a good orientation to the city as well as the best views of the houses.

Walking the area with Camera in hand !. Spent some time in the neighborhood. Great restaurants, Cheese Museum, Tulip Museum, Madame Blue shop, Albert Heijn supermarket, etc. Tram 2 stop is here as well.
Worth a visit ,in a relax mode!
One of the most beautiful of the canals. Have your camera at the ready when visiting Prinsengracht. We also enjoyed a lovely lunch along this canal at a great little cafe. We will always remember it.

Nice canal street. This is a nice canal street. One can take a nice walk along the canal and admire the shops and buildings in this area. There are some interesting boats parked in this area. I must say that this Gracht looks pretty much the same as the others. A nice walk nevertheless.

Neighborhood feel, with lots of tourists. My daughter lived near the Anne Frank house on this street so we spent a lot of time in the neighborhood. Great restaurants, Cheese Museum, Tulip Museum, Madame Blue shop, Albert Heijn supermarket, etc. Tram 2 stop is here as well.

Rewards return strolls. On a sunny day, the architecture and relaxed atmosphere and general lay-out of Amsterdam mean you come back again and again, deliberately or by chance! Don’t hold back, its worth it.
Vacation. We are having a fantastic time here! Our apt is simply beautiful! Easy walking to a lot of places! Everyone is very nice and they all speak English! Which helps us out a lot!
Take your camera. Every site is a must capture! Buy a to go lunch and just sit in the shade on the canal for a wonderful show.
A fantastic walk. What a special gracht to have a long walk and enjoy the activity of the gracht together with lots of shops, cafes and restaurants.

Beautiful street along a canal.. Stayed at a hotel on Prinsengracht which overlooked the canal. It was lovely to walk to and from the hotel along the street as the trees were flowering and the weather was perfect.

Great boat tours go accross. We went "free" with Lovels boat tour company by using the Holland Pass silver ticket for this one hour tour. It starts front of Central Station. Audio guard avilable in many languages.

One of the prettiest canals in Amsterdam. All the canals have a certain something in Amsterdam.The Prinsengracht, for me is one of the best. I cycle along most of it on my way to work and everyday it provides a new vista. Of course the Prinsengracht is where you find the Anna Frank museum, check my review, but there are lots of interesting cafes in the vicinity, also the Negenstraatjes cross the Prinsengracht and it digs deep into the Jordaan. What's not to like?

Another location not to be missed when visiting Amsterdam. A bit posh - but why not!? Like some other prime locations in Amsterdam laying on the canals, Prinsengracht is a must to be visited, either by walking or on boat cruise...pure delight! For shopping/eating/drinking there a rather thick pourse is recommended...

Quiet place with canals. Cobbled stone path ways and canals, coffee shops dotting the place it is charming and less crowded. Do wear good shoes though as it is a bit harsh on your fee walking around here. You can also do a canal cruise around the canals of this area.
Beautiful and Quiet!. This was a lovely place to walk through away from the hustle and bustle of the main city area. Even going around on a boat would be great too.

Canals are a huge highlight. This one was beautiful for its architecture and cafés but its not alone in these ateas. My favourite thing to do in Amsterdam was wonder the cobbled streets and sit in cafes like the locals do. A beautiful city for just this. A tip - the streets are almost all original which means cobbled or stone. It's taxing on the feet and legs so wear very comfortable shoes.

Hidden delights. While bustling with life the area wasn't noisy. The canal banks are lined with hidden shops, cafes, houseboats and of course the inevitable bikes. Canal cruise boats are constantly passing along with the smaller vessels, including pedalloes! The architecture along the canal is very varied, including the odd rooftop garden?
Love the cana. We stayed on this street overlooking tbe canal on a Airbnb it was amazing. Great shoping, awesome coffeshops and restaurants in the middle of the city walk or uber everywhere.
One of the canals. It is very difficult to value every "gracht" as they are very similar. If you take a cruise on the canals, you will definitely love each of them.
Pretty, great cafes. There are lots of cafes and sights to see on the Prinsengracht. It's quite long, so if you're older, don't expect to walk the whole thing.

Probably the Coolest Street for Kids in Amsterdam. Great walk with kids in the area - the canals, the Anne Frank House Museum, The Cheese Museum, The Tulips Museum! All in close proximity to each other.. with lots of restaurants and quaint shops around! The kids had great fun!@
Lovely Canal. We stayed along the Prinsengracht. It is one of the more picturesque canals - quiet with many boats in the water and bicycles going by.
Make Amsterdam comes alive. An absolute requirement while in Amsterdam is to stroll the canals - this and many others. Many boathouse line the canal bank. Lots of interesting side streets.

A must see walk around the Canals!. Great for a stroll down the (sidewalk)!!!! not street unless you would like to visit one of AMS fine Hospitals! grab a bite to eat or do some shopping. Just a beautiful walk with some great history!
Wonderful canal for strolling. This canal takes you to the Anne Frank Huis. It is filled with wonderful side streets/shops/lovely architecture and canal houseboats.

Best place for a pleasant stroll along the canal banks or a canal boat trip in Amsterdam. We stayed at the Mozart hotel on the Prinsengracht in early May .This canal has some of the best architecture and pretty houses in Amsterdam and is a safe , quiet district for pleasant walking. There are many pleasant cafe / bars on this canal ring and if you walk in the correct direction , you can see the Westerkirk and Ann Frank huis. We loved the Prinsengracht south area located near the Voldenpark and museum quarter. From this area we could visit the Leidenplein or walk to Dam Square in 20 mins . Recommend this canal ring for a more traditional Dutch experience.
Compare with Herengracht. A more comfortable scene on this canal which moors many houseboats and serves as home to a less formal populace.
Prinsengracht - wonderful. This is such a beautiful part of Amsterdam with it's colorful people sailing by in the boats and an absolute must on King's Day and not forgetting the famous 'Gay Pride''..

Best street in Amsterdam. This street is one of the loveliest, charming streets in Amsterdam. Our hotel was on this street and it's the perfect location. Everything is within walking distance. It's. A lovely street with beautiful residential homes and a few hotels. The sad part is the tourist are dirty slobs who throw their disgusting garbage on this lovely street. Shame on you tourist to litter and not respect the community. Locals have to sweep up tourist garbage, it made me mad rhat people do this in someone else's home street. Great location, great city, great, great, great

Beautiful quiet canal stay. We rented a canal boat here in April 2016. Quiet and beautiful location. We felt like locals and enjoyed living in Amsterdam as such. Shopping in the nearby local market, buying flowers for our living room and waving to the tour boats that cruised by. Priceless!

Cute area to look at the canals. This is a cute area to look at the various canals. I don't see it to be extremely too different from other areas. Nevertheless, this area has many restaurants and of course, the Anne Frank museum!
Nice place to take pictures. We learned about this place from our canal cruise. It has so many "scenes" along the canal that one can take pictures.

Quiet residential canal with lovely house frontages. If like me you enjoy looking at the different Dutch house facades, then Prinsengracht is for you. There are convenient coffee shops everywhere and some very good restaurants, but best of all it's quiet.

Quaint canal in Amsterdam. This is a very quaint area of Amsterdam, with a lot of cute houses and boats. The houses are all in very good shape, all taken care off, the streets are clean and tidy. It is just nice to stroll down this area in the sunshine.

Prinsengracht apartment rental agent in le Jordaan. If you're planning on staying for more than a week in Amsterdam I would recommend le Jordaan. You will truly feel at home because it is the area where all of the local Dutch people live. many grocery shops within walking distance as well as wonderful cafes , canals and boutiques. The enormous Saturday open markets are not to be missed. Many don't take credit cards so be prepared to have euros.  We hired a real estate agent Anke de Vries who can be contacted :YourAmsterdamhousing.com Anke set us up in a third-floor apartment, open and spacious with two bedrooms wonderful bathroom, washer dryer, full size refrigerator. Huge windows that overlooked the canal. It was within walking distance from our friends who live there and it was a safe area for our 13 year old granddaughter to walk alone to and from her friends home. Anke could not have been more helpful. She met us at the apartment, took her time giving us a full tour and helped us orient to the neighborhood. When we had phone problems Anke kindly contacted the airline to confirm our flight home and also printed our boarding passes. We were traveling with a stop in Iceland and she even confirmed our hotel in Reykjavik. I don't think we could have found a more perfect realtor. We highly recommend Anke. Patty King, Newburyport Mass. USA

One of the main canals in the heart of Amsterdam. This canal runs for some distance, flanked by a variety of colorful canal homes, many ancient but artfully restored. There seems to be an endless assortment of cafes, restaurants, coffee houses, shops and of course the bicycles that define this city. It is picturesque in every way, including residential houseboats along the banks and while looking like a postcard is still the REAL Amsterdam, were people live and carry on their daily lives. People embellish their small spaces with flowers and fresh paint and bits of art that really give this neighborhood a unique feeling. The Anne Frank house is on this canal. Don't miss a walk around Prinsengracht if you're in Amsterdam.
If you only walk one canal, make it this one. Start at central station and walk the full length of this canal. There is so much to see on both sides.
A grey march day. Not as pretty as Bruges or Ghent where we had recently tarvelled but the weather and greyness didn't help

Just get out and walk, especially at night. During our free walking tour we walked along the banks of many canals, he jested that the canals are based on the rule of thirds, one metre mud, one metre bicycles, one metre water, however whilst walking along this one we actually saw a a garbage barge pulling out mud and bikes with a crane. We found the best time to get the most of the canal is at night with all the lights twinkling on the water it is a beautiful sight.
Beautiful canal. Enjoy walking by the canal and admiring All of the wonderful houses.Cross over the bridges and take an opposite look .

Enjoyable strolling... Even in the rain. If you look at the map of the canals, you'll see this and several others running parallel to each other. They are fab for strolling up and down and they provide scores of photo opportunities. Thank heavens for the digital age... Film and printing would cost a fortune. Take care of the hundreds of cyclists, who are everywhere and all the time. Check out the shops in the 9 streets region. Great for window shopping...unless you've recently won the lottery.
Beautiful Dutch canals, houses, and houseboats!. This is an excellent venue for restaurants, hotels, and long/ shorter term, accomodations. You will love this place!

Worth spending a few hours wandering around. A friend mentioned this area and I'm glad he did. If you like wandering around, looking at architecture, sitting in cafes, people watching, and looking at houseboats then this is the place for you.

Love Love Love. The area surrounding this particular canal for me was the most beautiful in Amsterdam. This is why i went to Amsterdam for, it is much quieter and much more what i had expected. If i am honest the further away from Central station the better it gets but stop here before you enter the city. It is super interesting to walk all the way along the canal and through all of the back streets, go in the antique shops and admire the architecture. Absolutely lovely.
Fantastic. Walking along the canals and charmingly crooked row houses was a great experience. The children had fun finding the smallest and the largest houses (one was one window-width wide)!

Number 4 of the 5 Amsterdam canals. Walk or bike, there's no other or better way .... well, by sightseeing boat of course :-)) which gives you an even better view of the old houses + a (hopefully) interesting and/or very informative lecture. You can easily spend a whole day (boat/bike/legs) if you add the four other semi circular canals of the older center.
Just as you imagined. Walking up and down the Prinsengracht is Amsterdam just as you imagined it to be when you decided that this was the year you were going to the Netherlands.

The Old Quieter Amsterdam. Just strolling thru here is very nice. At night looking down the canals with the lights sparkling off the water is beautiful. There are lots of good restaurants in the area and people watching can also be fun.
Nice. Very nice walk, just try to look around for nice places to escape the cold, thieir really good at food and beer
One of the nicest grachten with lots of cozy cafes. All the grachten are very pretty, but Prinsengracht has probably the best selection of cozy cafes with perfect views and friendly service.
Upscale new canal place to be seen. Great walking, trendy shops and great food. A better time to walk the canal is at night. All the little restaurants have table service along walking paths.

This is the canal to take pics at. If you are looking for a beautiful canal picture to sum up your time in Amsterdam, this is the street to visit. Take a right out of central station and follow the canal through the Jordaan neighborhood and Prinsengracht will lead you to the Anne Frank House.
Beautiful canal. close to everything this is one of the biggest canals in Amsterdam. Several attractions right next to it.

Wonderful Stay. We had the pleasure of renting a house on Prinsengracht and would highly recommend the area to anyone visiting Amsterdam. It is centrally located so you can reach almost anywhere in the city within an hour walk. The Anne Frank Huis is located on this street as well. The views of the canal can't be beat while walking along Prinsengracht. Top notch viewing and location!

A stay at Prinsengracht. "Our" street in Amsterdam...rented the most wonderful " top floor room here, at Airbnb. Superb!! Both the old house, our host, the canal...all the cosy shops and cafes...go for a stroll here...sit on a cafe...experience a boat coming in next to your table....see the friendly citizens....
Wonderful views. Wonderful views of the canal, and a very relaxing place to stop and stay for a while. Very accessible, good for photos

Great for a stroll.... We walked along that street for half an hour and loved the sights all around. The buildings have such a unique architecture that is typical to Amsterdam. It is a great place for a stroll and enjoy people watching.

Beautiful street next to the canal. One of the most prominent canals of Amsterdam; a great place to stroll around the city. Especially at nighttime this street is great for wondering around Amsterdam. A very typical part of the Dutch capitol.

Prinsengracht - - very long streets. We headed to Prinsengracht to view the sites, find Anne Frank's house and a restaurant we had heard about. We took the tram and found the street but walked for an hour 1/2 to find the places. Shops are near the tram stop but mostly residents along the canal. Wear good walking shoes!

One of the most elegant places in Amsterdam. There are three 'gracht'-s in Amsterdam these are semi-circular rings, on two sides of an atmospheric canal: the Herengracht, which has the most elegant houses, the Keizesrgracht in the middle and the Princengracht, the outer of the three beauties. All three are filled with the most beautiful, historic buildings, houses built by the richest merchants during the famous Golden Age, when Holland ruled the waves. Walking along these is the best experience you can encounter in this town. It costs nothing and you will have the best time of your life! If you get tired or thirsty, just pop into any of the numerous cafes lining these canals and enjoy the world biking by! Enjoy!

A channel not to be missed. This is one of the nicer channels of Amsterdam with great architecture that really shows how nice these buildings are.It's a street where one can walk leisurely and enjoy the views, the nice stores and cafés and appreciate the best this city has to offer.

We stayed here while on holiday. We rented a lovely flat here while we were holidaying it's lovely and quiet and there is a nice coffee shop/restaurant that does THE BEST apple pie in Amsterdam that everyone has to try :)

Nice residential area. We had the good luck to be staying in a house on Prinsengracht (thank you Homelink!). It's a lovely neighborhood overlooking the canal. The houses date back to the 17th or 18th century and are well preserved. There are little cafés, antique shops, and other small boutiques on street corners. It's not far from the Rijksmuseum, so if people have time, it's worth getting a little way off the beaten track to explore this part of Amsterdam.
Lovely place to stroll. This is a great spot to walk along the canal. Take your time and stop for a coffee or a drink. Admire the architecture and the canal boats.
Take a stroll. Really nice area along the Prinsengracht canal. As others have noted, architecture, houseboats and general scenery are all great. Watch out for the bicyclists!

Beautiful Canal area. This is a beautiful canal to walk along. So many interesting buildings to look at. Very pretty in the summer, the bridges have lots of flower tubs. I was here in the spring this year and although not quite as pretty it was still a lovely and peaceful walk.

Canal street. If you only had half a day to view the canals of Amsterdam, this is the place to go.
I went here to see the Westerkerk, Homo monument, Anne Frank statue. There's also a herring stand in the Westermarket and an array of coffeshops facing the canal.

Walkabout. One of the attractions of Amsterdam is that you can walk for hours and hours. It is really nice to be able to look at the amazing architecture away from the hustle and bustle. Watch out for the bikes, though!!
lovely architecture. This is an ideal walk along one of the many canals whilst admiring the canal houses and boats. Lovely bar called Nels on this canal where the locals gather on a sunday

Just beautiful. Great to just sit and look around, near Anne Frank House, always busy with people, but a beautiful area to see. If you like photography, also great for that. The canals are also beautiful here, much as they are in other areas.
Lovely stroll. Because the Westchurch and Anne Frank House are on this canal, it's a place you're going to walk anyway. Take your time and enjoy the architecture.
Beautiful central canals. The Prinsengracht is a truly wonderful part of the city. The canals are absolutely beautiful. Even on a rainy day they are magnificent.

Nice walk from amsterdam central station. Prinsengracht, Singel and Joordan are nice picturistic area in Amsterdam. Although accessible using the tram, Amsterdam is a compact city so its better to just wander on foot.

Gorgeous view of the canals. A romantic, special section of the city where true Amsterdam is on full display. A stroll or bike ride through this area is unforgettable and a must do for anyone visiting Amsterdam. Trams run on regular schedules and provide easy access.

Very nice overlooking the canals. This is a nice peaceful area of Amsterdam. From the top end of Prinsengract you can catch a number 5 tram to central station for 3 Euro's. This is a very large street. In this area there is a lovely omelette restaurant. There is also a houseboat museum you can visit. Be careful and mind the bikes. There are no skips or bins just place your rubbish at the end of the walkway. The Anne Frank house is also along Prinsengract, you can't miss it just look for the queue. All in all it is a very nice area especially at night when the quaint lamp standards are lit by the canals.
beautiful. beautiful place too visit we enjoy alot in prinsengracht weekend is too good lot of people walk in the street singing songs and lot to see canel in night

Romantic shopping. superb and romantic with so many quality shops that you may miss the rest of Amsterdam.The houseboat museum is a nice typical place to see, and when you want to sit and have a drink the cafe Molenpad is great, it has a terrasse on the canal's edge.

Beautiful area of Amsterdam. Very nice on a sunny to rent a boat or cycle! There are some hidden artworks and courtyards on Prinsengracht so it's cool to explore this area in the heart of Amsterdam. Lovely to watch the boats on a sunny day!
Nice walk. A very nice walk along one of the canals. Quite centrally located. Boat rides go out from here. Lots of shops around.

Our holiday neighbourhood!. We were lucky enough to rent a basement studio flat for a few days on this canal. Lovely views from our window, peaceful at night, cafes and restaurants within a few minutes walk, tram and supermarket two minutes away. We wandered into the centre within half an hour in one direction and were less than ten minutes from museums in another direction. Beautiful houses, quirky shops and houseboats. What's not to like?

Loads of great cafes/bars.. Most interesting of the 3 main canals - several museums and Anne Frank's house can be found here. This canal also has the best cafes and bars of the 3. Best of all it is home to the fabulous 'Space Oddity' - little shop selling old Star Wars toys and the owner knows his stuff.
Lovely canal district. Our hotel was in this area and it was great for evening walks with lots of restaurants, cafes and shops.
Great long weekend. I recommend Amsterdam and this area in particular - it has everything within walking distance that you could ask for in a long weekend.

Lovely Architecture and houseboats. If you find yourself on your own in the city this entire area really is a must do. I took a morning to myself to explore these beautiful canals and was not disappointed. The surrounding area was beautiful with all of the slanted buildings really flexing the character of the older areas of the canal belts of Amsterdam. The house boats also posed a rather interesting canvas.

Best canal to walk along in Amsterdam.. Avoid the crush around Dam Square and head for sanity of this lovely canal. You'll find lovely architecture with interesting cafes and shops. My family and I enjoyed a wander along Prinsengracht after a visit to the Ann Frank Haus and enjoyed pancakes at the Pancake Bakery and apple pie at Winkel 43.
lovely canal & street. Stayed here last week - walked and meandered up and down it, tried the other canals but this was the best

The easiest canal to see in Amsterdam. The classic boat tour of Amsterdam spends about one third of its total trip distance in this canal, rendering it the most easy and convenient to see (in comparison to other known Amsterdam canals). Nevertheless, it is not something special or different from the other canals you might see.
Classic old Amsterdam. Well, it meets all stereotypes (and it's a good thing!): canals, old buildings, even some trees. It's very pedestrian friendly and just a short walk from the Central station.

SO PRETTY. "you can feel the amsterdam atmosphere here perfectly, also it was very pretty at night/evening an di recommend walking there in the evening time when all the lights light up on the bridge and in the canals such a pretty sightit is such a beautiful place to see, very "amsterdamish

Lovely walk. ..well it would be if you get the weather. Our day was was a little greyish & overcast. Still the canal houses which grace this gracht are hundreds of years old and have lovely architecture / facades. And its, of course, free :)
Europe 2015. Its Spring and windy. Gush of fresh air keep me energetic and i love the calming scene around the place.
Perfect location to stay in Amsterdam!. We stayed in a small B&B on this street and I loved the location. Central to all of the canals and an easy walk in any direction.

Pretty area. Lots of little cafes to sit to eat watch people and boats.
Even got a couple of little museums to visit.
Just watch out for bikes. They ride everywhere
Nice Neighborhood. This is a nice neighborhood. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Stayed in the area for 6 days and couldn't get enough. Would love to go back soon.
Romantic. The various "grachts" - canals - in Amsterdam are all romantic, but I guess the Prinsengracht is one of the best.
a beautiful canal. This was our third visit to Amsterdam, and somehow we have always been attracted to this lovely canal.

On the Prinsengracht are many monuments and famous is the Westerkerk and Anne Frank House.. PRINSENGRACHT The Prinsengracht Canal, named after the Prince of Orange, was built in 1612, at the initiative of Mayor Frans Hedrickz Oetgens, after a design by City Carpenter Hendrick Staets, and surveyor Lucas Sinck. On the Prinsengracht are many monuments and famous is the Westerkerk and Anne Frank House. The Prinsengracht makes part of the Canal belt along with the Keizersgracht and the Herengracht.
Great place. Great place in Amsterdam, kids loved it and the sun was shining. Nice people as well. We visited this area alot in Amsterdam.
Surrounded by lovely places to eat. Enjoyed a number of restaurants in the area as we were staying on the Singel so very close. Great atmosphere in the area

Gorgeous Canal. This is surely one of the loveliest canals in Amsterdam. If you want to take some gorgeous photos on Amsterdam, this is your spot. Just ambling and enjoying the surrounding beauty is a terrific way to spend some time. Don't miss this spot.

Lovely walk, interesting houses and shops. Well worth a stroll, Prinsengracht has some lovely houses, window displays and shops, including one selling items from Mongolia and another selling lots of Japanese furniture, art and kimonos. Well worth a stroll. Also we found a fantastic little Moroccan cafe on a corner, a great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Historical perfection. We toured the Prinzengracht via one of the city sightseeing water tours and were marvelled and amazed at the way the old traders houses were still in pristine condition and so well looked after. Recommended
Just like a dream.... A charming place surrounded by extremely beautiful architecture! All the places around Prinsengracht is like a dream...
Lovely canal. One of the most important and rich canals. Most lovely to visit by foot and to visit nice small restaurants and/or bars.Look to the old Legal Court , that will reconsructed into a hotel

visit the excellent houseboat museum (Woonbootmuseum) here. Charming and instructive host for whom the museum was obviously a labour of love (I had two coffees chatting with him), both a converted houseboat itself and full of information about the houseboats of Amsterdam. Only 4 euros I think. Drinks available.
Beautiful canal area. One of the principal central canals, Prinsengracht is lovely for walking and taking a canal ride, or orienting yourself to the city centre (follow the canals, not your maps!).

Beautiful street. Enjoyed it both day or night. Walking or through the canal tour. You can find many cafes, restaurants, art galleries. The buildings are elegantly designs. The street has many important places, Anna Frank's house, the church next door. And lots of picturesque bridges connected both sides.
Larger canal. All the canals are beautiful time well spent to walk around the city's X enjoy the history that surrounds you

Magnificent. Prinsengracht is one of the three oldest and biggest channels in the downtown area of Amsterdam; pretty old bourgeois houses, cruise boots with admiring tourists, many bridges with parked bicycles - it is a unique feeling of this city

Breakfast,pool and snooker.. Walking up Helligeweg towards the Leidesplein,the shopping is superb.About 400yards before the Leidesplein is Prinsengracht on both sides of Helligeweg.If you walk 75yards to the left,there is an excellent Snooker and Pool hall on two floors and the beer and service is excellent.Also.the cues are well maintained.If you go right on Helligeweg along Prinsengracht,there are a couple of nice breakfast cafes,however,it's probably best to book in advance.There is also an excellent breakfast cafe not far from the Carlton Hotel on the right hand side of the flower market.If you're unsure where to go for a great or special nights dinner,head for Rembrandt Sq and there is a Gauchos near the cinema 300yards from the square.The food,service and ambience are all simply superb.
lovely canal. We ate at a restaurant/pub on this canal. It was a great way to enjoy Amsterdam like a local. Amsterdam is a beautiful city.

A Good Way of Seeing Amsterdam. The outer of the four central canals, the Prinsengracht provides a good walk to see what Amsterdam has to offer. After visiting the Rijksmuseum we picked up the canal and walked north as far as it went.Lots of good shops (eg delftware) and sights en route such as the Anne Frank house and the Westermarkt. equally the street has abundant great bars like Zotte, Cafe Smalle, Papeneiland and De Pieper where you can stop off for a beer and a snack. You also fringe the Jordaan area of the city and can dip into the Nine streets. Make sure you have plenty of shoe leather.
Great Thoroughfare on the canals. Great street amazing architecture, hidden gems along the way, coffee shops bars restaurants, markets.

lovely to see. we went on a boat trip to see the canals of Amsterdam and prinsengracht was very nice part of the cruise we also did a walking tour along the canal which was fantastic if you come to Amsterdam you have to walk by and cruise by a boat

Great evening photo spot. The Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht are both must see canals. The section where they intersect the reguliersgracht is the most photographed due to the quaint bridges with the semi-circular portals lit up at night.

Simply lovely. . Have to say we were lucky with the weather, but really enjoyed a stroll along this beautiful canal. The houses along it are beautiful and there are lots of attractions on route. We strolled fromWinkle 83 via Anne Frank's house and onwards. Also visited the Amsterdam cheese museum and tulip museum (more like shops with museums added on). A lovely walk and really good way to see Amsterdam at its best!

The Prince of Canals. Prinsengracht is an impossibly adorable street/canal in the old section of Amsterdam. The many residences and light commercial establishments are tasteful and don't scream "tourist trap" like other sections of the city. We always like to include Prinsengracht in out route when walking through the 'Dam.
Typical canal view.. Popular canal views. Clean and attractive. Would be lovely in the spring or summer but not a lot to see on a very cold February day.

Lovely canal and street. We enjoyed strolling down this street and admiring the architecture of the houses and the house boats. Seeing the bikes whizz past, meandering over the bridges (which look extra beautiful at night when they are lit up) Wish we could have spent more time here.

Lovely part of Amsterdam . Beautiful canal, lots of nice cafes, central location- 2 minute walk from Anne frank house, 10 minute walk from Dam square, 20 minute walk from Vondel park and night club strip.
Peaceful. A very beautiful and peaceful part of Amsterdam. Great place for a gentle stroll taking in the sight of many old Dutch buildings and the canal.
Beautiful area.. This area in the middle of Amsterdam is perfect for holiday-goers. I would recommend visiting the area on a sunny day, for sure.
Beautiful Area. We stayed on a houseboat on Prinsengract (213) with a lovely view of the canal and area of great architecture. Absolutely beautiful and very peaceful area of Amsterdam.
Beautiful canals. Our hotel was right next to this beautiful canal, lovely to walk up and down, cafés and restaurants are found on either side.
Beautifull canal!. Wonderful to take a stroll along the canals and view the splendour of Amsterdam! The Prinsengracht canal can also be enjoyed by taking one of the many boat tours on offer!
Beautiful . Really lovely area to stroll around or to ride around on bikes. A must visit to get a real feel of Amsterdam. Very picturesque.
Cool part of Amsterdam. The typical architecture of the city with many cafes, restaurants, shopping and walking distance from the famous museums
Stroll at leisure. A great place to just stroll slowly and take in the sights. An umbrella and warm clothing makes it all the more enjoyable during the winter months.

A wonderful canal in al lseasons. This is one of my favourite canals to stroll or cycle along. There is always something to see on the canal & it is charming at any time of the year. There are a host of pretty canals running off the Prinsengracht & it borders the wonderful Jordaan district.
Nice canal next to the Anne Frank House. Nice place for a stroll. I walked down nearly the whole length and admired the canalhouses and browsed the shops.

Beautiful canal. One of the main canals of Amsterdam.Also,the streets that follows its banks have the same name.A good way to see the canal and the beautiful old buildings on its banks is to take a boat tour(there are several companies offering this kind of tours in Amsterdam).If you buy an I amsterdam city card the boat tour is included.
Great to wander anytime of day. As with most of Amsterdam this is a beautiful area and the buildings are fabulous, we walked this area in February and the scenary is still fantastic
beautiful scenery. It's really relaxing being here and there's always a pub or restaurant near by for drinks and snacks.
Very beautiful canal. Strolling along the Prinsengracht is a treat for the senses. Beautiful architecture, quaint shops and boats and people to watch. Take some time and enjoy this lovely spot.

One of the 3 known canals. Prinsengracht, keisersgract and herengracht are 3 of the main canals in Amsterdam. I would take a free canal tour if you will purchase I Amsterdam card and see around all those 3 canals. They all have nice houses around but the nicest is Keisersgracht. (Having the Greenswood restaurant we visited 2 times on a 3 day tour). Reachable by trams. (I guess it was tram number 5)
A very nice canal. This canal is amazing. I had a nice time there. The houseboats and old buildings are beautiful. This was one of the best places I visited in Amsterdam

Lovely quiet meandering on the street, or preferably on a canal boat.. Beautiful view from a canal boat of the houses and happenings in this typical Amsterdam location. Full of character and so very European.
Love it here . Such a beautiful canal perfect for taking a few pics, lots of shops and coffee shops off the main roads near this canal, we always stop and re made to feel so welcome

A good canal to use to Navigate around the city. I tend to use this canal as a map focus point to Navigate my way around the city. With Anne Frank House, at one end and crossing between Dan Square and Leidenspien . Plenty of galleries, shops and Cafes its a great place to centre your meanders around the city
Fab. strolled along here and enjoyed the views! faboulous flowers and little boats along the canal! lovely for leisurely strolling :)

Glorious. We stayed right at the Amstel River and walked right round the Prinsengracht to the station. The canal is lined all along with traditional canal houses and in places houseboats to peer at. Also enjoyed from a boat tour..

One of the nice Amsterdam canals. Like the other canals this is a nice canal to visit. Maybe not as spectacular as the others, but certainly well worth strolling down the canal, or even better sailing it. When you do, please visit De Duif, a beautiful old church building - still being used for services.

Classic. This street/ canal is decked with houseboats, restaurants and lovely old buildings. Lovely to stroll along the cobbled paths and spend some time taking in the view.
But I find that every street in Amsterdam city has something special to offer.

Magical. The canals are wonderful and flowers line each one, it's worth going on a canal boat for a tour around the sights of Amsterdam to get the full experience. This city is beautiful and the nature is wonderful, recommend anyone to come here on a European city break!

Classic beauty in Amsterdam. Also a must visit place. Great cafes, classical places and typical dutch setting. Walking around you will find a lot of great places, and a coffee at the Chanel is a must in Amsterdam!!
A principal canal - best experienced from a boat. Best seen (and explained) whilst keeping warm on a canal boat trip - this canal has many architectural feature to be seen on its banks as well

The Prince's Canal. Walking along the canals are always a pleasure. This was my favourite canal. The Prinsengracht takes you up to the Amstel River. There are lovely buildings, residential homes, houseboats, cafes and bars.

Nicer area. We did not find this area until the last day of our short stay as we spent most time at the museums.
This is a much nicer area than the centre of Amsterdam.
The houses are very pretty. Plenty of nice cafes.

Beautiful.. Very beautiful part of amsterdam. A stroll along here is just what's needed when you want to take a break from the busy main tourist attractions. Lovely houses, houseboats, cafes and bars. Lots of photo opportunities.

Love this area.. I go to Amsterdam a couple of time's a year and no mater what the season this area alway's look's beautiful and is alway's at the top of my list of destination's to visit.I love walking down here after dark as it look's amazing ,dropping in and having a coffee or beer in a nice café and just watching the world rush by.The canal look's amazing with the barges and boat's and the old beautiful merchant houses,it's picture postcard perfect.A great area and well wirth a visit.

Pretty bu don't go on a cloudy day. Lovely area however we went on a dull day and I'd definitely recommend keeping this one for a sunny, clear day. Lots of nice little cafes around to enjoy. Worth exploring.

Prinsengracht is where you hang out for a characteristically Dutch stroll along the canal. No matter how many days you spend in Amsterdam, you'll have encountered this canal road called Prinsengracht which is decked by restaurants, coffeeshops and nightlife options. You'll pass through this place MANY times while soaking in your Amsterdam experience. The downside: the tourists. They're way too many of them for my like. The shutterbugs are irritating and everyone wants to pose next to the canal holding hands etc. Ever had a hot dog in one hand and a beer in another while walking along Prinsengracht. The feeling is epic, man. You'll love it.
great view. a relaxing walk along the Prinsengracht is always welcomed and needed. Grab a drink or something else [lol] and find a bench watching the boats go by.
Picture Perfect. I fell in love with Amsterdam and walking along this canal/street is what did it. The mix of little shops, homes, and riverboats was perfect. Can't wait to go back!

picture postcard amsterdam!. This is one of my favourite street/canals in Amsterdam, beautiful typical Amsterdam house and stunning houseboats, a great place to just sit and appreciate the beauty of this city

Lovely to just have a wander around. This is a great district in just to wander around, maybe have a coffee or a beer and watch the world go by. We did just that and criss crossed the many bridges and canals to blow away the cobwebs!

Take a Boat!. Make sure to also travel the Prinsengracht by boat. Most tours take this route before going onto either the Amstel or the Ei. On the 27th of April, this is where the Kingsday parade moves through. if you are in the area during this time definitely make sure to visit and watch all the boats. loads of cool bars and places to eat located on this canal.

Beautiful. My favorite area of Amsterdam. . Loved our stay in the Prinsengracht. Best walking streets, cafes and shops. Markets were great and canals stunning. Buildings were sites to see, and it's away from the main touristy blocks. So you can breath a little lighter :) will be back one day to stroll those wonderful stone streets!

Dont miss it !. Very Charming River Trip in BoatIt was Cloudy Day, amazing trip, The Captain served us Drinks during this nice trip,Captain were explaining to us the place we passed through and the history/story for each

The Epitome of Amsterdam. Like a travel postcard of Amsterdam, the Prinsengracht is the epitome of Amsterdam. Great place to walk and take in the sights and sounds of this amazing city. Lots of people watching, just be careful where you're walking as canal bridges are everywhere. Especially nice at night as the lights of the district and the boats give a very tranquil atmosphere to your visit.
very nice. Just a cozy walking around the gracht we loved it it was in January a bit cold but perfect for pictures.
City of canal. It's a great place to go for evening walk, although it's about croweded in time but canals and boats will give you a feeling of being in actual amsterdam
Great location. Really picturesque part of Amsterdam. Great to wander around, looking at the houses and houseboats. Very pretty at night with all the lights.

Picturesque Area of Amsterdam; Great Location. We rented a houseboat on the Prinsengracht Canal for two nights in December, 2015. Great location. Heard the chimes from cathedral every hour; walked 2 blocks to the Anne Frank Museum. Also visited the Tulip Museum and purchased custom approved tulip bulbs to take home to US. Watched sunset on canal as we walked around the city. FYI for Anne Frank house. Buy tickets online and be there for opening of the museum. If not you could be in line around the block even WITH tickets. We walked by many times and ALWAYS had a line around the block.

Beautiful canal area, very typical of Amsterdam!. Home to Anne Frank, the main site of Amsterdam Pride in the summer and a quaint canal so typical of Amsterdam. I lived just around the corner from here and frequently walked up and down her on my travels. It can be very busy towards the crossing at the Rozengracht (the nearest point to Dam Square). The Amsterdam Pride parade uses the canal as a main point and the area really is vibrant during this time. Anne Frank's house rests just before Westerplein at the Rozengracht and this area can be really busy!
Beautiful water way !. We really enjoyed walking along the canal and looking at all the houseboats. It's really pretty at night. Very relaxing to sit and just people watch!
Picturesque Evening Walk. When are you standing here in the evening, its more beautiful, and you feel like you are in the perfect place at perfect time. Happy Vibes.
Walk!. What a lovely walk! The buildings, the house boats, the stores on the south end of the quay... I can't say enough
Great Area Of Amsterdam!. Great area of Amsterdam, If you have time I'd suggest to have a walk around the suburb, take in a coffee or a beer and enjoy the beauty!

most beautiful canal of the grachtengordel?. walking along Prinsengracht is a joy. It's my favourite canal in Amsterdam and affords so many wonderful spots for photos and views.
Take good walking shoes, and take your time - great for a sunny day. not so much fun in te rain!

Truly beautiful. It’s practically impossible to pick a favourite between so many canals in Amsterdam. From Herengracht, I walked up to Prinsengracht. The sun already set. Just like the postcards I saw in tourist shops, the view in Prinsengracht was charmingly stunning. It was so beautiful that I revisited the canal the next day, at noon. Day or night, you will be amazed.

One of the finest canals in Amsterdam.. This is one of the most beautiful Canals in Amsterdam with historic and charming architecture. There are several historic sights and wonderful bridges. The canal house boats are lovely to see.

The famous canal in Amsterdam. This is my favourite canal in Amsterdam, where all the major boat parades happen during special occasions, like King's Day, Gay Pride, or stage for the Grachten Festival.
Very nice to spend the afternoon. lovely street and lovely bulding, very nice place to stroll around in the afternoon or cruising the canal.

The typical street of a Dutch city!. Is a beautiful street but it not delivers anything more than any other street in Amsterdam or other Dutch city by the canal! Nonetheless, if you are in Amsterdam, it worths the visit!

Lovely area for a stroll. It was really nice just taking a leisurely stroll along the Prinsengracht, watching people going about their business and taking photos of the wonderful buildings. Actually just watching someone park their car at the canalside is quite an event as it's really nerve-wracking, there are no barriers at all and any person or car could quite easily fall in the water!It was very peaceful along this street, and it was great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds near the centre of the city.
Pretty area. Lovely little area for exploring Amsterdam, either by foot, tram or canal trip. Lots of little side roads, Quant and quirky shops to wander into.
Pretty. Such a nice canal ring even in the winter. A shame the canals were not frozen over when visiting in December but plenty to do around this area.
Atmospheric area. It's lively to stroll along here, admiring the architecture and enjoying the various little cafes and shops alongside the canal.
Wonderful Place nice location. I love the location of the hotel. Walking distance from most things in this city. Clean rooms, helpful staff.

Beautiful and historical. This features the Anne Frank House and the Westerkerk and its really interesting to walk down or see on a canal ride. The Wester Café is also located diagonally across from the anne frank hose on the other side of the canal is nice and cosy for winter.

Best location for a stroll. We walked this area during the day, enjoying the architecture. New Year's Eve was magical as we walked to the Skinny Bridge for a great place to view the fireworks. Our corner in front of this well visited spot was looking both at the bridge & the Opera House. Even our corner had a marvelous display of fireworks to ring in the New Year. Someone nearby stated, "we found THE best spot tonight", I couldn't agree more.

Lovely, Busy area, Lots to do. Stayed here in January and when I visited Amsterdam again in December I visited this area again as there were so many good restaurants and things to do, lots of shops and plenty to see. Really nice area that isn't as busy or expensive as the center with lots to do !
Location surrounded by so many tourist attractions. Very convenient to travel by public transport. Near to Flower market, Amsterdam center, Dam square and Leidsplein....

Awesome...visit twice once in Winter and Autumn..just beautiful. Love the canals and just take time and explore each corner and stop for coffee, and just snaps as much picture as you like. None of the house look alike and each have their own uniqueness slight angle which lean towards the river, narrow and perfect. Boat house awesome to look at which have own creation make it beautiful too look at or each window you pass by, owner really spend time make it very interesting with their own design.Don't rush walk or stroll and you never know what you have come across ...Have Fun.

great "U" shape canal, worth viewing.... This is one of the beautiful "U"canals that is well worth walking along the whole thing if exploring the city. Will walk past the nine streets of Jordaan also which is lovely in itself! Stop off to see the boutique shops.

great walk, lovely architecture, shops and canals,. This is one of the 3 main streets that goes round the city. We did walk parts of the other two but this for us was the most interesting. The canal side is beautiful, the architecture is incredible, and every so often there are a number of quaint boutique shops. A really lovely place to walk, explore and get the feel of the city.

Lovely House Boats and very quaint area. This is a beautiful area with many shops and restaurants. It is a bit away from the tourists and quieter which is great. The tourist areas are just a 15 min walk away. It is a lovely area and a must see in Amsterdam while visiting the canals.

Houseboat rental on Prinsengracht. My wife and I have been to Amsterdam over 10 times over the years. This time we decided to try and rent a houseboat on one of the many canals. At the last minute we found a houseboat for rent through House-Boat Hotel website. We want in the spring time so hotels can be very expensive in Amsterdam. Luckily we were able to rent a houseboat B124 which was a brand new listing. We were completely pleased with the houseboat. It was very spacious with 2 bedrooms/1 bathroom, kitchen, washer/dryer, and a large living room. It was located on Prinsengracht canal which had patio chairs on the deck of the boat which we used to sit outside and see boat after boat pass right by us. - that was a lot of fun. Prinsegracht is a great location because we were literary 1 minute away from the street cars.
