It also had restaurants all around the area and a grocery store around the corner.the houseboat was so spacious and private that it best any hotel plus it was 'cool' to be on a houseboat. If you ever get the chance -try one- you'll love it!

Very interesting area of Amsterdam. We were fascinated by the buildings along this beautiful canal area of Amsterdam, and were interested in their history. We walked the area by day and again at night when the illuminations for the Light Festival were lit. It was good to wander and immerse ourselves in the beauty, history and atmosphere of the whole area.

Unesco World Heritage / a must-see!. When you say Amsterdam, you also say the world famous Canals. Since a few years Unesco World Heritage. Take a guided canal-tour and enjoy all those great Canalhouses. The prinsengracht is also the decor for a few famous events: The Prinsengrachtfestival (Classical music), when a floating platform is built in front of the Pulitzer Hotel. During the grand finale people lay their little boats around the platform and enjoy the music while sipping their white wine. On the first Satuerday of August huge crowds watch the (GLBT) Canal Parade, More than 80 decorated barks with their GLBT crew and many 'straight allies' (Police, Armed Forces, political parties, etc)sail in a parade through the Prinsengracht Further, every year in December and January there is the Amsterdam Light Festival with many light sculptures on the Prinesengracht. One secret tip: allthough the main streets in the old centre can be quite crowded, the canals are often really tranquile.

timless and still changed.. when i first lived in amsterdam it was on this street that i lived., it was an old hippie enclave filled with cracked houses and alot of orange frij state folks. not any more. it is all cleaned up, very spiff and very expensive and lovely. it live . this is a city that is a living place.
Calm and tranquil. A walk along the Prinsengracht or even a boat ride takes you in and out of the many canals, it is very peaceful and tranquil.

Elegant canal with beautiful buildings!!!. One of the great canals of Amsterdam lined with beautiful houses showcasing their own special features. Strolling down these narrow canal streets is a feast to the eye. There is a lot to discover. I love the small side streets because it's where you'll find many cozy little shops, bars and eateries where locals shop and eat.

One of The best Canals. This canals is one of the best and most beautiful. The buildings are very luxurious and there are many beautiful restaurants and shops around. Here you will also find Anna Frank House

Canals Ahoy.. Amsterdam is a great place to explore by foot but do not leave without a good canal cruise where one will really enjoy the sights. Prinsengracht is one of the largest canals. The water wasn't smelly and the sights were fabulous. The houses quaint and pretty along the canals. It was great to observe the houseboats and delightful alfresco dining.
Go in the evening. The Prinsengracht (Princes canal) is where some of the most expensive houses in Amsterdam are located. I recommend going early evening to get the best photos.
Lovely Canal Street. Lovely to walk along or sail along, night or day. In December you get bits of the Lights Festival which is 'brilliant'! A must do in Amsterdam at any time.

Lovely street and river. Stayed in a hotel on the street loved the area, close to everywhere just a walking distance.
Visited the Anne Frank house that is on the same steet.

Beautiful. The canals are absolutely stunning. They are so quaint, the different types of boats, the shops and buildings. It's so pretty here! I love seeing the differences in each little area. The flowers are everywhere, bikes and people riding through the streets. Always a beautiful sight!

Take a boat trip..great way to see the canals. Beautiful historic area...interesting architecture, most the houses look like they are slowly falling sideways. some nice small restaurants to be found along the canals too.

Our favorite of Amsterdam Canals. Whether navigating to and from dinner, shopping or coffee shops, we use the Prinsengracht as our compass in and around Amsterdam. If you are walking, by all means stay alert and be mindful of the bicyclists and their dedicated lanes when crossing streets and what can appear to be sidewalks in some places. They dominate the transportation system and take no prisoners. Boat tours can be arranged and I highly recommend them as a way of seeing the wonder of this great European city.

Always worth a great walk, bike ride or boat trip.. Any time of the year this canal is worth to walk, ride or sail along. Do it on your own, not organized, and watch gorgeous canal houses and enjoy the trees. Why don't you walk it after sunset? The Dutch hardly use curtains and so you can peep into the living rooms and see the beautifully plastered ceilings, the wooden beams, the art and furniture. And please come here at the first Saturday in August for watching and enjoying Amsterdam Gay Pride Canal Parade: 80 well decorated ships with themes or come to the Prinsengrachtconcert at the third Saturday evening in August and enjoy a life classical concert on the water. Can you get into a boat in front of the floating podium? Bring your drinks and snacks and join the singalong at the end!

Wonderful neighbourhood . This city really is a lovely city full of wonderful views, walks, architecture. No many times I've been here, I still like to explore.This neighbourhood area of the city is wonderful, beautiful and certain parts you can tell are the high end areas.Just lovely.

One of the Most Scenic Canals in the City. Walking along Prisengracht to the Anne Frank House and through the Jordan District is beautiful. The canals are very romantic and relaxing. There are several cafes and bars with cute shopping options along the way.
Better than crowded central channels. Beautiful part of Amsterdam. Here you'll find lots of shops and restaurants. Not so crowded and the prices are better than in inner channels.

A high end neighborhood. This is a very trendy high end neighborhood. It was cool to see the nice homes and boutiques but all in all you just need to walk through it and go on to see something else. Maybe stop for a coffee or a bite to eat, it is not a destiantion
Very picturesque!. Love this canal with it's impressive houses and cute little shops! Really nice for a stroll, a cruise and picture taking!

Mesmerizing and gorgeous walk in the heart of Amsterdam. Wheter if you walk or take a bus boat, this is one the loveliest areas of the city: gabled old Dutch houses, elegant bridges, canal tree lined streets, lots of small coffees to have a drink,… It really feels quintessentially Dutch and you imagine this picture in every postcardWatch out the reckless bikers… Strangely, in one the of the most enjoyable cities to walk around you have to be extra careful with the bikers…
Pretty as a Picture. This is a lovely area and every block is truly worthy of a picture - we stayed here for several days and never tired of the neighborhood.

Beautiful area. Along one of the canals you can see the special way the buildings are made.Walk around and look at the other side of the "gracht"And on your way you will find enough places to take a photo or have a rest.
Lovely part of the city. Nice walk down this street along the cannal. Alot of lovely cafes and places to stop whilst wandering down a scenic part of the city. Enjoy the stroll and watch life go by.

Enjoyable place for walks. For me Amsterdam is very chilled and relaxed city. Prinsengracht is an embankment by water with tipycal Dutch buildings. There is no too much tourists. You can walk and enjoy the views of the water and open windows of Amsterdammers apartment with very nice designs. You can even feel yourself as a local there. You can also find there some stores and nice cafes.
Gorgeous stretch of canal. Loved walking along Prinsengracht. The Anne Frank is located along this canal, as are many other beautiful canal homes.

The view is very nice!. You have to go there if you visit Amsterdam which known as their canal. although when I came there the weather was not good (its cloudy and raining), but we can still see the beatiful building, canal, and boat there.
Must see in Amsterdam. This is one of the things you can do when you don't know what to do and don't want to spend so much.

A walk from the Jordaan to the zoo along the canal. The most versatile canal. On the west side of the canal you start in the Jordaan and on the other side of the center with the nine streets. As you wander along the canal, you meet halfway the Leidsestraat. A little further you go over the Amstel river and you can extend on the new Prinsengracht to Artis zoo on the east side. You can eat and drink on the go anywhere.
World heritage canal. My highlights of this canal are the western church and cafe papinland. The Anne Frank house is on this canal as well.

Dreams of Living on a houseboat!. We spent half a day walking around this area of Amsterdam and it is very charming. There are restaurants, coffee shops, cafes, church's, some famous spots and tons of bikes. I really enjoyed looking at all the house boats and was imagining living there with my herb garden and bottle tree on top of my houseboat. Then I found out how much they cost and my dreams were dashed away. A really great area to walk around and take in the culture of Amsterdam and watch the boat traffic on the canals!

Beautiful canal. This canal is clean and gorgeous. With its bike-lined bridges it truly feels quintessentially Dutch. The buildings and shops along the canal are some of the best. But my favorite way to experience Prinsengracht was from the water on a canal cruise.

Picturesque. Wonderful canal views surrounded by great variety restaurants. Charming side streets to explore with a variety of shops. A short distance from the busy city center with less tourist and more residents.

Wonderful Canals and Prinsengracht one of the best. The canals of Amsterdam are beautiful. Who is to say which is better than the other? The Prinsengracht is certainly a canal to be explored, marveled at and enjoyed. Walking this and other canals is a very pleasant experience and with the right person it can be a romantic experience. Along these canals you will find all variety of houseboats, some with gardens and little terraces, some rather luxurious, and you can imagine yourself living in one. If you are walking, you will find little coffee shops and cafes where you can sit outside alongside the canal and take in the people and the sights.The canals are best seen on a tour boat which will travel them all and allow you to see beautiful canal-side homes, churches and canal traffic.

Interesting. Spent several hours walking around the canals. Using a guided walk from a Dorling Kindersley we could identify different houses and their past history. A good way to spend an hour or two.
Excellent area. This was an excellent area to stay in central and had avovely atmosphereWould recomment this area Stayed in the decor cannal house also excellent
Canals of Amsterdam. We really like these 4 canals around Amsterdam. We spent some hours strolling beside them, specially prinsengracht. We walk both day and night, never forget this experience.

a beautiful place in Amsterdam to visit. As a child I always stayed on this canal. Its one of the most interesting parts of Amsterdam and you get the full experience of being in Amsterdam staying on a canal. You can cross back and forth across the bridges and its not very far from the main part of Amssterdam, the DAM square. If you can stay close to this waterway, try. Its just so beautiful and it gives you the full feeling of being in Holland
great canal of a great city. One of the beautiful canals that ring the central district of Amsterdam. its a beautiful site especially at night
Lovely area. Plenty of bikes & trams here. Lovely lights on the bridges. A lot of shops, cafes & restaurants around here. A few hotels here too :)
the grachten in utrecht are better. this place is ok. it is busy, to many tourist cars and bikes. you cannot take a time to experience this
lovely stroll. lovely stroll enjoying the café culture in the sun shine. Need to take care of the cycle paths as they merge into the roads
Amsterdam and its canals. I can't say enough about this area. Houseboats like the canals, bikes along the road, cats all about...

lovely seen from the canals. Every where you turn there is something interesting to look at.The autumn colours seem to suit this place really well, with the yellow of the leaves striking against the darker feature of some of the houses.

Grand view of canal with many beautiful spots. While Venice, the other city famous for canals has only one big grand canal, Amsterdam offers three-four concentric canals and couple of harbors. Prinsengracht can easily be classified as "most famous" of them all. It houses many luxury hotels and prominent buildings - Anne Frank house, West Church etc. It showcases some really good architecture and few vantage points offer great views.

Lovely areaand close to the Best Pancakes in town!. This is a charming area; we went on an hour long boat tour,and got a different,and wonderful view of the area. The architecture here, house boats,and the bridges, are a great place for photos, too! This area is where The Pancake Bakery, at Prinsengracht 191, not far from the Anne Frank House, so when you plan to come to this area, plan to go eat pancakes, too!
Love this canal. Love walking and cycling along this canal, especially some of the views that you get of the Churches
Beautiful views. Enjoyed sitting with a glass of wine on the banks watching the tour boats/world go by. We were very lucky with the weather at this time of year
Nice walk!. Some of the boats along the canals are just adorable, and bike traffic isn't as bad as elsewhere, so you can actually dare to explore as a pedestrian.

Beautiful place to stroll.. This and nearby canals are wonderful to explore on foot. Charming architecture, beautiful settings, indoor and outdoor cafes all over the place. Experience the use of bicycles as an amazingly effective mode of mass transit.

Nice idea to see Amsterdam on foot. Nice place to walk along the channel (gracht), to look at rickety Dutch houses, various boats and barges on water, to feel Dutch atmosphere. Cobblestones are not comfortable for buggies. Be careful and beware the bicyclists!
The Beauty of Amsterdam. The Prinsengracht is obviously the nicest of the old towm Grachten - if one can say so. At least all Grachten are unique and must be seen during an Amsterdam stay ---
The Main street center location!. The best street to walk along and stay in if you like apts. Its the main street you can walk or take a canal tour.

Beautiful area to walk along & enjoy. In spite of the cold, wet weather this was still a beautiful area. Take your time and stroll around, there are shops and cafés to enjoy as well. It is also so relaxing to walk along and enjoy the views and the canal. Lovely area.

Very grand!. Of the many 'grachten' of Amsterdam's Canal Ring, this is one of the grandest - and it boasts several of the capital's finest hotels (at a price). All major attractions are virtually within walking distance.

most typical Amsterdam look and feel. With the most beautiful houses this street is the most typical Amsterdam street with canals and bridges. Everywhere bicycles which just go with the flow. Close to "de Dam' and central station in walking distance.

Lovely. If you take a boat trip you will inevitably traverse the Prinsengracht. For me it's a journey best undertaken on foot. I would head for Haarlammerdijk close to Central Station and wander its speciality shops. Assuming you can tear yourself away, follow Prinsengracht for as long as your inclination takes you. Lots of history,architecture, bars and eateries. Trip boats maneuvering, pretty houseboats -even pedal boats and canoes! Boutiques, galleries and shops with lots of opportunity to people watch.But before your daydream completely overtakes you remember you're in Amsterdam. Watch out for the kamikaze cyclists! They will sneak up on you silently and scare the pants off you! Walk carefully and enjoy!
A Lovely Area. During our 4 day stay we spent the majority of our time here. Such a beautiful area. We could walk along the canals for hours and not get bored.
lovely area for a stroll. A great area with shops and bakeries, trams are frequent to this area. you can get off here to walk up to Ledisplein square for all the restaurants and bars.

Discover the secrets if this canal. Most visitor know about the Begijnenhof, that enclosed area with a garden and small houses build by the riches for the poor elder women. But there are many more hidden, and most of them located at the Prinsengracht. If you start walking the Prinsengracht form the Haarlemmerstraat direction, than you find at least three of them at the left side. Usually covered by a big huge double door. If they allow you, take a peek and be surprised how you suddenly walked into a quiet calm serene world in the middle of a noisy and busy city. But even without them, the Prinsengracht is a lovely walk with some nice little stores and also some very good galleries.
The Canal Trip. The one hour boat trip is really good. I would do the hop-on-hop of boat tour. You see the bridges and the the nice old houses.

Good area. We had our apartment near the Prinsengracht and I think we made a good choice. The area is quieter than closer to the center, the canal is nice and it has very nice views for photographs with probably less people than in other more interior canals.

Not one to be missed!. You think once you've seen one bridge in Amsterdam you've seen them all... but the Prinsengracht is one of Amsterdam's most photographed sights. By night it truly is something spectacular, it's located within 5 minutes walk of the Anne Frank House in the heart of the Jordaan District. Don't miss it, it's breathtaking!
Lovely Early 17th century canal.. Nine feet deep, canal houses dating back to the early 1600's. Very lovely to stroll along the canal early morning or in the evening. Watch the bikes!

Excellent Canal Experience. Great by boat, but even better on foot! Loved getting lost and exploring new streets in the Jordaan District and meeting new people. Another amazing canal, neighborhood and great for pictures and people watching.
This is Amsterdam. Take a walk and enjoy all the many bridges and house boats. Then, catch a boat trip and enjoy a guided tour on the water ways. Both views offer so much to see and enjoy
lovely. Like all the canal streets in Amsterdam, the Prinsengracht is scenic and lovely. Definitely worth several wanders.
Beautiful Area. Took a canal ride and looked at all the house boats and amazing architecture of the buildings. If you are on a canal tour just keep looking up at the buildings.

Picturesque!!. Took a canal cruise by day. Quaint and a nice way to get off your feet and explore the canals. Try the on off canal cruises so you can explore a bit more rather than just doing the round tour.

Great Place for a stroll. There are the 3 Grachts (Canals) and this is the one where the upper class used to and still does live. Get a tour guide (I used Lindbergh Tours in the old town just down from the Train Station) to fill you in on what you're seeing.

Busy narrow canal….plenty of things to do and see!. During our stay in Amsterdam, we travelled along this canal both via a hop-on, hop-off canal boat and also on foot along the streets next to the canal. It is a fairly narrow in places but still manages to accommodate a large number of canals boats either travelling along it or moored on either side of it. The streets alongside the canal are tree lined which generates a nice atmosphere and they provide shade on a hot day. We appreciated the scenery which included quaint canal houses, interesting bridges and despite the busy waterway, quite a bit of birdlife.Anne Frank’s house, one of Amsterdam’s premier tourist attractions is located on one side of the Prinsengracht. We were amazed by the hectic activity in the vicinity of this attraction. Whether is it was the canal boats coming and going, delivering and picking up visitors from the quay or the crowds of people queued along the roadway, it certainly was quite a hectic place! If people are seeking a bit more “laid back” activity, we noticed that there were foot-propelled paddle boats for hire from an office, just along from Anne Frank’s house.The Prinsengracht is certainly a picturesque and interesting canal. There are plenty of things to see and do there. You just need to be aware that in places, it can become a bit crowded and busy.

Grab a Shoe boat and take in the views. Such amazing experience to travel thru the canals in any type of boat you can find. Imloved the scenery, viewing the home styles, the buildings, the many people from around the world. A must see
Nice. If you visit Amsterdam you can not miss the canals, everyone in the world associates Amsterdam with the Canal system, very relaxing and nice place to be

Quintessential Amsterdam. For me this area of Amsterdam with its parallel and interlocking canals is the best area to stroll around with no other purpose than to soak in the sights and sounds of what walking the Amsterdam canals are all about.As others have mentioned best done early in the morning or late evening when the visiting tourist hoards have departed. We were lucky to stroll it again on a recent Sunday evening and it was still as good as the first time I did it many moons ago.
My homecanal. Yeah, what should I say. When I am not traveling, than this is my view every day. How great is that!

So Many Canals With Fantastic Views. We took a walk along the Prinsengraacht while strolling to and from Anne Frankhuis Museum. The cold winds and the rain prevented us from a leisurely stroll; however, the beauty and views along the canal are obvious.
The most beautiful canal belt. It offers a beautiful view of the canal. Not too crowded, and you can walk around to enjoy the view. I find it quite relaxing.

cliche, but one of my favorite parts.. this is like the number one area that everyone pictures when they think of amsterdam and see photos but honestly it's because its 100% beautiful. I loved just walking around and people watching and see all the boats go by
Strolling. One of the best streets/canals to walk down. Thought alot was going on in and around this part, Amsterdam is a defo place to go.
Very nice spot. Very nice place to visit and drive thru with the bike. Interesting things to see, like the house boats.
Good walk.. Very therapeutic to walk in this canal all the way through. Not too commercialised and not crowded at all. You can feel the true Amsterdam in this canal.

Nowhere else is like this. wandering along the Prinsengracht canal is a must do Amsterdam thing. While it can be crowded with tourists, the amazing houseboats, swans, and bicycle traffic make for a real Dutch treat. I prefer to walk it in the early morning when young mothers are on their bicycles with a child or two (or three) in tow. On a perfect weather day, the volume of canal traffic is remarkable.

Favourite of all the Canals. Yes a return visit in October and whenever we arrive and see the Prinsengracht it's always welcoming and we're always pleased to be back. In October the trees lining the canal are taking on their autumnal colour.
Very Interesting. Was great on the rented Boat we just sailed around the canal's....zits not so hard to drive around on the Boats and its good fun as you can have a lot of people on just for some fun

Awesome canal ;). Walking on Prinsengracht is not a disappointment ! It takes you to all part of central Amsterdam and is very typical. All the houses are gorgeous. This canal is surrounded by restaurants and shopping street. We are renting a flat with a view on this canal and we just love it.
Relaxing atmosphere and nice shopping. Nice area to stroll. Enjoy coffee and walk around in the Joordan area. Nice atmosphere and "typical" for the city.

Beautiful art/antique galleries. Amsterdam is a great city to walk around and explore the small shops and right off Prinsengracht is the neuwe spiegelstraat whihc is a part of the art district. It has numerous art and antique galleries. An amazing afternoon can be spent exploring the galleries, loved this area of Amsterdam. Amazing art.

Popular Canal. Prinsengracht is very popular with the tourist boats and some of the more interesting building designs can be found on the canal side. In reality we found walking along the canal not to be as romantic as expected due to constantly dodging the traffic and bicycles. Foolishly we hoped to sit by the canal and watch the world go by, but there is a distinct lack of seating/benches. Has the potential to be a pleasant walk on a quiet summers evening if you have the chance!

The Prince of Canals. This is only one of the canals that are visited by the tourist canal boats. It is a fun canal, because the houses along each side provide a great contrast to the often drab and damaged vessels sitting in the water. It is said that canals are three meters in depth, with one meter of water, one of mud and one of bicycles.
Beautiful canal!. One of the most beautiful canals of Amsterdam, nice to do a walk or to see it from a boat. Famous to be the place near the Anne Frank house. Recommend!

A big part of the character of Amsterdam.. It's a simple visit, but the canals are a big part of the character of Amsterdam. You have to spend some time around them and travel on them to get a feel for the city.

Best Canal to live and be Dutch.... Best place to stay, eat, drink or just roam about. It literally means Pricesse's Canal and is the best of all in AMS.Very easily accessible and almost all of the Canal Tours runs through this canal.

Early Morning or Evening. One of the best things about Amsterdam is just going for a walk. Everything in the city is so accessible on foot and taking the time to work along Prinsengracht in the early morning or evening is well worth it. Make sure you have your camera ready.

Amazing place in Amsterdam!. It's really worth walking down this street enjoying the lovely bridges, boats and of course bicycles ;) The only big disappointment was an almost total lack of benches! So my plan to seat with the book enjoying amazing views didn't work :(
Take a stroll. Another one of the many canals you have to go. Beautiful architecture, nice place to stroll and take pictures. If you are on a bike it gets better.
Best time to visit: early sundaymorning. Best time to visit Prinsengracht in early sundaymorning. No traffic, few tourists. Look up and enjoy ancient architecture.
Take a Stroll. This was our favorite canal walk. The houses are lovely and there are many houseboats to see as well.
Pretty. Beautiful buildings line Prinsengracht, as well as some eateries. It is nice to stroll along Prinsengracht just enjoying the atmosphere.

Excellent especially after rain! . The sky clears out after the rain .., so the sun shines on buildings with reflections on canals... Soooo pretty!!! Yes it does get chilly and windy when it the rains :(

Fine for a Long Stroll. The canals of Amsterdam are well known but Prinsengracht is particularly fine for strolling and looking at the boats on the canal. It is well located for visiting the Rijksmuseum and good restaurants are nearby.

Dusk on the Prinsengracht. A stroll along the Prinsengracht gives you the 17th c scale of Amsterdam and an idea of the wealth of the new merchant class. I suggest dusk - so you geta glimpse of the interiors as well!
very nice place. very nice place with high buildings. lovely,friendly people also.We had great experience with the bikes & the busy city.

The "Princes Canal" - Enjoy from the banks, or by boat. This is one of the city's most famous canals and can be toured on foot or by canal boat (I suggest both).Lots of elaborately gabled-houses (a throwback to the earlier rich merchants) and some nice street cafes and squares on either side. From here, it's an easy walk to the boutiques and restaurants of the Jordaan district, where you can also find a couple of markets, if you time your visit right.

The loveliest of all the canals!. A very picturesque area worth exploring and photographing. Set some time aside to stroll along the canal, taking in all the ambiance. The lighting changes as the day progresses. So if you are a serious photograher, you will want to spend most of the day capturing those specials moments. The canal is lined with cafes, shops and bars. This is what makes Amsterdam so special!

Brilliant for Strolling. It's hard to say more than it's a great, great path to stroll. This canal seems to host a greater nobility than the adjoining canals ... a bit broader, a bit less crowded on the sidewalks, and maybe a lesser need to jump out of the way of cyclists. I probably missed some fine shops along the way, but I was too taken in by the sights.

Prinsengracht is #1. We stayed in an airbnb on the Prinsengracht and it turned out to be one of my favourite canals in Amsterdam so I was really happy we stayed in this area. Lots to see, great restaurants and shops nearby and close enough to walk to the train station. Easy to get around from here as well... and a very fun area to ride a bike.
Picturesque. Interesting canal. Anne Frank's house is situated along here, along with Westerkerk (church) and a little museum on a houseboat.

True Dutch Atmosphere. For those Visitors coming to Holland, in this case Amsterdam, do your selves a favour and see this special Canal . You will see the special Dutch houses some from 17 century in the special Dutch style. You will see special boats and barges cute bridges and Its a living Art space. some houses are all crooked and leaning . Now make sure you have a city map with you as its so easy to get lost from street to street as its so interesting you often tend to wander of in some side street. But don't worry most roads around the Gracht will in the end lead to Central Station......And Most if not All Dutch people speak English and are allways happy to help. See it and bring your camera...

PRINCELY IT IS. One of the most beautiful and varied canals in the rings that circumnavigate Amsterdam Central. Well worth a stroll along its length toi take in the architecture, shops, a caffe or two and the boats.
Central stayed in this area. Beautiful area, hotel was around the corner from the tram line. Nice cafes and bars here and a lovely fountain and park area nearby to sit
Beautiful canal!. Stayed at a hotel on the Prinsengracht. Definitely worth the money for a canal view. Lots of sites--Anne Frank museum, Wester Kerk. Narrow sidewalk, lots of bikes.
Don't miss. The heart of Amsterdam. For us, one of the nicest settings we've seen. We would actually consider buying there if we were to move to Amsterdam. Check it out.
lovely amber colours at night. A very good spot for a care free stroll of an evening. It borders the Jordaan district which is the cooler, more locally populated area.
The Rythem of the City. We enjoyed spending time on the street/canal. It was very busy with both tourists and locals, giving a lively sense of activity and energy. Just watch out for the bicycles!!!
Its a canal.. Its a canal, what else can you think of it. Of course the houses look very nice. But of course this it typical Amsterdam
Relaxing. Really nice area to walk and sit to have coffee overlooking the canal or watch the plant/flower market

Lovely place in a lovely city. Lovely place in a lovely city. The houses, the boats, the bridges, the people,... Everywhere you can find a place to see, to take a photo, to have a rest, ...It's wonderful!

Exploring Beautiful Canals... It is a must do if you are in Amsterdam, for all ages, this trip will help you to understand the city in a better way, the architecture and engineering of this city is like no one else in this world, you will really enjoy I told the short trip then decide to take the long one 1 hr 30 min or 3 hrs tour. there is a tour for all type of people touristy and noisy with drinks and food included or luxury and quiet special for lovers..

Pretty, quiet part of the city.. Just far enough away from the bustle and noise of the city centre but still close enough that you can walk everywhere !!! Find a hotel with a view of the kanals ... adds to the romance of your visit !!!
Great Sights to See. Very nice Buildings to See along the Canal, You get to See the Anne Frank Huis which is well worth a Visit.

Heavenly place. Ansterdam's canals are something unique in the world. This zone of the city is quite silent and peaceful, the only sound you can hear will be the bell of the bikes. It's absolutely wonderful in springtime where the flowers born and the buildings on the canals become colorful.
Nice street for a stroll. The street in Amsterdam is a central location as it's only a 10 minute walk to central station, close to a grocery store, cheese shop, some restaurants, and cafes.
Postcard perfect. Fascinating architecture and flowers everywhere. Stroll along with the crowds or grab a seat at a cafe and watch the show pass by.

Perfection as a place to stay if you can. We couldn't have done better than to rent a houseboat on the Princengracht. What a perfect location. Surrounded by an amazing selection of bars, restaurants and local shops, moored on one of the most popular canals in Amsterdam. We`sat on the deck with a glass of wine and watched all the river traffic passing by. An easy walk into the centre of town and about 5 minutes from the Anne Frank House.

a must do!. Amsterdam's canals are all amazing, I would say that I loved every one of them.Visiting the canals, both on boat and walking, is a must do experience in Amsterdam. Once in a while just stop by, while strolling around, and don't forget to admire Prinsengracht's amazing architecture.
Worth a walk. Moving away from the central area opens up the views. The roads seem wider and the houses are wider too. Recommend to walk all the canal sides

Quintessential Amsterdam. A lovely canal area that represents everything that most people think of when they imagine Amsterdam - visit it, walk round it, go through it to somewhere else - but take plenty of photos, and kiss your girlfriend on the bridge!
Very pretty . A beautiful area of the city, loved it at night. Actually proposed to the love of my life on this trip where the Prinsengracht met the Leidsegracht!
Great canal. Great place to sit and watch the various canal boats, ducks, coots etc. Or just a nice place to walk. Cafes etc are nearby. You can access various parts of it by tram.
Best canal on our Amsterdam canal cruise.. Outstanding canal with gabled houses of several eras, houseboats, and the Anne Frank House. A lot of traffic, but well handled.
Simply walking and enjoying doing so. You go to Amsterdam for several reasons, one of the are the channels. As long as you like to walk, there is no way that you can get bored.
Pleasant strolling. A nice semi-residential road pleasant to walk on a Sunday morning. The bottom end is in Haarlemmerbuurt which was also well worth a visit.

Nice place. We stayed in an apartment on Prisengracht so enjoyed the great views and character of the place. Seemed to be full of pubs, coffee shops and cyclists so gave us a good experience of Amsterdam.
Top Amsterdam canal. We passed along this canal as part of an Amsterdam cruise, very nice wide canal with most of the largest and most expensive houseboats in the city located here.
Only in Amsterdam. All I can say is excellent about this place. Great serivice and the food was outstanding. Have a seat at the var and wait for your table. Its busy for a good reason.

Romance on Tap. Some cities just have it, and Amsterdam has it in spades. if you do nothing else but aimlessly wander around the canal district in the evening your trip to Amsterdam will be with you forever. A more romantic city does not exist.
Cafes to savour. Beautiful area for wondering about, lots of pavement cafes to watch the world go by and listen to the church bells. Anne franks house is also here.
Eternal Beauty. I enjoyed strolling on the banks of this canal as well as cruising in the canal. The architecture is marvelous and the atmosphere is so peaceful.

Great place to stay. Beautiful area to stay in. We were lucky to be advised by someone familiar with Amsterdam to look for a place to stay in Jordan. We found one through trip advisor and have had a wonderful stay. It is a great area and there are loads of cafes all a little different. A great range of museums are along this canal including Anne Frank's house, the cheese museum and one about tulips. Canal boats cruise along and it is a great way to see the inner city

Beautiful Canal. We walked up and down the canal several times, as well as crossed over it. It is quite scenic with lovely architecture. We also road on a boat down the canal and it is a lovely way to experience the city.

Canal of Principe, important people's canal.. One of the 3 major canals (Heren-, Keizers- and Prinsengracht). The plan for these canals has been started from 1613 onwards, when the mayor (Mr Oetgens) and the city-carpenter (Mr Staets) developed the first city-plan in the world. Houses are more narrow than along Heren- and Keizersgracht (compare resp. 532 at Heren-, 753 at Keizers-, and 1131 houses at Prinsengracht). Along this canal you'll find markets, e.g. Noordermarkt, Amstelveld.

charming. great to walk or bike. Plenty of shops, restaurants, etc. Good people watching, water gazing, fun to be had. I used it on my daily commutes around the city. You might even find yourself listening to a musician on a boat as we did.

The most popular gracht because of the sightseeings that goes along. At the 22nd of August we specially went to Amsterdam for the grachtenfestival. http://www.grachtenfestival.nl Each year it's presented on the Prinsengracht. Its free and it's very popular. The most amazing thing about the festival but also the Prinsengracht,is that the people sing a long on a song which tells the story about the grachten of Amsterdam: the lyrics are: Aan de Amsterdamse Grachtenheb ik heel m'n hart voor altijd verpandAmsterdam vult mijn gedachtenals de mooiste stad in ons landAl die Amsterdamse mensenal die lichtjes 's avonds laat op 't pleinniemand kan zich beter wensendan een Amsterdammer te zijn. Any gracht in Amsterdam is beautiful, but the Prinsengracht has of course Anna Frank's house and the already mentioned festival. Except from Anna Franks house: free of entrance and beautiful to look at, to walk along or to visit it by boat. When you go by boat you'll see the amazing typical houses of Amsterdam in a better perspective as from the streets. A must see in Amsterdam.

Most beautiful canal. One of the Girdle canals that semi circles Amsterdam east to west. Calm and serene, this canal boasts the West church, Anne Frank house and the canal barge museum. Lots of nicer restaurants here matching the nicer neighborhood. The Jordaan neighborhood is adjacent to the Prinsengracht canal. Well worth an aimless stroll. See how the real Amsterdamers live and dine with the locals in their restaurants
canal. beautiful houses on bth sides of the canal. The Prinsengracht is the canal furthest away from the center.
lovely place for a stroll, ride or drink.. Lovely Canal - we found ourselves gravitating to this area of the city. Beautiful architecture, nice cafes - lovely part of Amsterdam

Beautiful place for a walk. Prinsengracht is one of the main semi-circular canals in Amsterdam.We stayed in an apartment on the Prinsengracht, just 20 minutes walk from Centraal station. It's a great place for a walk or a cycle, with tons of small cafes, bars and restaurants all with great beer and food.The canal itself is of course free - but you'll find places to visit like the Anne Frank Museum, the Westerkerk and the Noordermarkt on Saturdays. Definitely check it out, along with Amsterdam's other canals - although I couldn't say this is particularly any better than any of the rest.
Nice stroll. Like any other gracht it is simply to go by and pass over the brdiges. Nice place to stroll and look at the boat and houses.
The best canal belt.. The best canal belt in my opinion with lovely sights and places to chill and relax as well as to have good food.

You must wande along this area in Amsterdam. Amsterdam is so easy to walk around and the Prinsengracht is a very pretty and nice part of it to visit. Really nice to just stroll and take in the canals and buildings around.
Worth and visit. A scenic and buzzing canal to wander along and enjoy the impressive and often quirky architecture of Amsterdam.
Nice Place. I rode a bike along this this Beautiful view. Its also a great place to go for a leisurely walk and have a look at the shops.
Brilliant..... This is another adventure you must experience it is a great way to get round Amsterdam attractions and the canals are a must see.

Hop off, Hop on tours. When in Amsterdam, definitely consider the 48 hour Hop off, Hop on canal tour. Allows for 2 days of unlimited use on their red, green & orange lines. Between all 3 tours, you tour almost every major canal, from the outer harbour to the inner city. Very picturesque, and stops are available at every major attraction. Runs from 9:30 am to 6pm. Well worth the money.

Parade day.. This place is a must for Amsterdam pride, get there early to pick a spot because it gets very busy. It's also a great place to go for a leisurely walk and have a look around all the quirky shops.

Love looking at each home on the gracht. What a wonderful way to discover Amsterdam. When the sun is shining and you have time to wander from canal to canal you can experience all the delights of this beautiful city. Prinsengracht has so many beautiful homes to admire, I love it. The history and how beautiful the homes are maintained....it's a wonderful walking tour which we thoroughly enjoyed.
Anne Frank's house street . Walk around it. There is places to eat , right by the canal. You will be right there anyways so before or after your visit to Anne Frank's house , walk around.

Canal cruises highly recommended. So my husband and I did the lovers canal cruise that sails along Prisengracht, Brouwergracht and Herengracht. All canals are picturesque and a sunset cruise is a fantastic idea. Herengracht canal is the most chique of all three, but we loved the 1 hour cruise tremendously and would do it again.

Leafy canal splendour with quirky architecture. Take a stroll down this beautiful historic canal, and look at the marvellous buildings that look as though they are crowding each other out, some bullies pushing whole houses into only a couple of meters wide. Leafy, relaxing and picture perfect for much of its length, this is a good start for a stroll (smaller canals off this and others also lovely for a coffee and a chat).

Lovely Amsterdam!. Walking along these picturesque canals, Amsterdam comes to life! The canal house architecture is iconic and the boats along the water complete the picture. Each house has its own personality and this is one of the prettier canal streets.

Peaceful . Whilst we stayed at dam square our pals were staying in a boutique hotel in this area.On several occasions we walked to their neighbourhood and couldn't believe how calm and peaceful it was.A total contrast to the tourist areas we normally visit.Well worth a visit. Lovey bars and restaurants here which are considerably cheaper too.

Quiet walking space.. Well worth a walk for the little shops and cafes. Nice to get away from the manic crowds in the centre of the city. Some interesting houseboats, and lovely greenery in the summer.

A beautiful street alongside a canal. Both tourists and locals love to stroll along this beautiful street which runs either side of one of the main canals. It is interesting to look at the amazing architecture of the houses that were built in the 17th century. There are many cafes and bars and quaint shops and it is a photographers dream location.

Amazing looking area. On our last day in Amsterdam we visited Prinsengracht in the hope of getting into Anne Frank House to pay our respects as it were. Unfortunately the queue was phenomenal!Our daily tram into the city took us by Anne Frank House and the queues were always, always, always extensive no matter what time we passed by. Sadly, as we had a finite amount of time before getting the plane home, we had to give it a miss, and instead went for a stroll around the Prinsengracht area.We has floated through this part on our canal cruise where you are immediately struck by the fantastic looking buildings and architecture. Apart from Anne Frank House, the area was far less busier than, say, Dam Square, and we were grateful for it, as it meant we could wander around the streets (with luggage in tow) without being hindered by great throngs of humanity.We sat by the canal and watched boats and other contraptions float by - the only thing spoiling this was the massively overflowing public bins. We pressed our faces against the windows of many a café or bakery to get a view of their wares. We took pictures of funky looking buildings and waved at other tourists as they drifted by on their canal tour. In short, this was a lovely area to visit, and in stark contrast to the bustling city centre.
Prisengracht - Prince's dock. Beautiful trendy part of town with many boutique hotels, restaurants, bars and praces to visit near by.

Beautiful. I stayed on Prinsengracht. It was lovely. How it changed on the Saturday when the gay parade was on. I have never seen so many people in my life. The rubbish left behind was incredible, but they got most of it cleaned up over night. Trams go past very regularly

Special neighbor hood in the city!. Very picturesque neighborhood along the canals. Walking and strolling along the canal and streets is a favorite pastime of locals and tourists alike. Great photo opportunities. Some good hotels in this area for visitors. Great food in restaurants and nice shopping this area.

An amazing walk awaits you along the Prinsengracht. The Prinsengracht is one of the four main canals that run thought the centre of Amsterdam and probably the prettiest.On the banks of the Prinsengracht you will find the Noorderkerk (Northern Church), the Noordermarkt (Make sure you come here on Saturdays), AnneFrank Huis, and the Westerkerk. No matter if you walk along or travel by one of the tour guided boats - You're in for a lovely day if you're on the Prinsengracht. I like to take away from Wok To Walk on leidsestraat and sit on the bank watching the boats go by. Also, Ijscuypje is the best Ice cream in town (Prinsengracht 292 + other Branches all over the city)

Beautiful Area!. This is such a great area of Amsterdam not to be missed. Our hotel (Hotel Pulitzer) is on this street. The canal is beautiful, there are lots of little shops in the area or it's great just to go for a stroll.
Lovely walk. Nice area full of interesting museums, sights and cafes. We enjoyed walking along this area, Anne Franks Huis is along this walk.

A different perspective of the canal by boat. We took a small boat canal tour, which we pre booked. The smaller boat seems to navigate the canals a little easier than the larger boats and has a better atmosphere with the driver at hand to answer questions. We love seeing the housing and street activity from the boat and their's no better location than the Prince's Canal
Apartment. We rented an apartment on this canal for the Pride parade and the views were amazing. Lovely buildings in decent location of Amsterdam city centre and its attractions.

Loveliest, liveliest canal in Amsterdam. Stayed in an apartment overlooking this canal and loved every inch of it, from the fairly domestic end we stayed in to the quirky shops, eateries and museums further along, all the way to the Jordan district at its other end. If you're a photographer - eat your heart out, so much to feast the eyes on. Great atmosphere, both 'young' and cultured, a little wild at heart yet safe feeling. Best place to stay in Amsterdam, if you can manage it.
Beautiful. Beautiful and clean.... Unlike the canal areas in the center, this location is less crowded, clean and is very beautiful.... This is where u can really appreciate Amsterdam
Went to is it anne frank house and house boat. Museum. Really pleasant hotel to explore with lots of interest things to see, including anne frank house and house boat museum.
Great place to be. A lovely place with great restaurants A place to take a picture In this area you can feel Amsterdam at its best

A great walk. Nice walk,lots of architecture. Walking better than view from the water. Watch out for the bicycles! There are some nice restaurants and shops along the way. If you are mosey, look. Into some of the flats, amazing.

A great walk. Away from the tourist route and lots to see - if you look up. Gables and roof lines are interesting but watch the traffic and also the cobbles or you may find yourself in the canal! I just love walking the main canals since I see something each time I am there and also stumble across small bars and cafes to stop in, as well as some interesting shops in the small side road, selling things that are much classier than in the main drag.
Pleasant Canalside Walk. A small amount of traffic, but Prinsengracht is a pleasant, relaxing canalside walk with several interesting shops and cafe/bars.
Beautiful. The most beautiful canal of Amsterdam, lots of restaurants and amazing old buildings, Anna Franks house is there.
Beautiful. Very iconic and significant. You cannot miss going here by visiting Amsterdam. You should also take a boat trip for visiting this lovely place, like hop on and hop off.
Great for Mooching. Although best seen from the water, we enjoyed a stroll and visiting little shops and bistro's. Well worth the effort.
Heaven. Absolute heaven sat having coffee watching the world go by so relaxing and amazing views , just sit and relax taking it all in

Check out the architectural gems in Amsterdam. Good to have a cruise or walk along the canals to look at the architectural gems in Amsterdam. Take the motorised boats as the canal bikes look easy but require stamina :-)
Take a boat to see it best. Taking a boat tour is the best way to see any of Amsterdam's waterways. However, Anne Frank's House is on Prinsengracht, so this has more significance than most.
Taste of Amsterdam. Lovely area to wander around alongside the canal to soak up the atmosphere of Amsterdam, with lovely old buildings to gaze up at.

Boat, Bike or Walk the Canals. A must Do !. Walk , Bike but do the canals. Each is different and all are worth the wander. Each has lots of shops and cafes, as well as great little Brown Bars. I worked in an office on Prinsengracht back in the 70's. It was a pleasure to be back and off to what was my favorite Brown Bar.
Canal Trip. The canal boat trip was great up the Prinsengracht Canal - nice and relaxing. The commentary was also very informative about the houses and houseboats on the canal.

Gorgeous and picturesque area if Amsterdam away from hustle and bustle of Red Light District. Recommend the area to stay if you are coming to Amsterdam and you are an older couple.This area is about a 10-15 minute walk to Amsterdam Central. Personally I found the shopping better in this area Than the Central Area.I recommend The Andaz Amsterdam Hotel. Artsy and modern hotel. Gorgeous toons and views of the canals. I love this area. It is not too crowded on the sidewalks to walk and lots of lovely shops, restaurants and cafes to stroll into if you choose.
Worthwhile. Worth taking a walk along and viewing the houses and the flowered canals. Even better if you are able to do it on a canal cruise
nice walk along the canal. nice walk along the canal, where you can see the boat houses as well as beautiful rich houses with typical Dutch facades.
Apartment with a view. Great place to be and feel like a local. Everything at walking distanceI rented an apartment with a beautiful view of the canal
Beautiful Canal Area. We enjoyed a long walk along this quiet canal. In addition to the houseboats their are many fine examples of traditional homes along this canal.

Prinsengracht canal. This is a lovely canal ( very long)-very pretty with lots of green trees and restaurants and cafés. It is also the canal on which the Anne Frank museum is situated. It took us 40min to walk from the start of it to the Anne Frank house-we were slow at times (looking around). And average at others. It is a great canal to walk along and get a feel of this area.

A must on a trip to Amsterdam. The section around the Anne Frank House has so much to offer, good restaurants, bars and attractions. Not to be missed are: Café T'smalle, Café P96 and the Pancake Bakery. We did an evening Pizza cruise around the canal, very picturesque. We were also there for the Gay Parade, fascinating and most entertaining. Go there!!
Some other views of Amsterdam. A relaxing trip with with the family on boat give different interessant views of Old Amsterdam. A Must see

Beautiful. We had to cross this canal on our way walk to Anne Frank House from Westerkerk. A very beautiful canal indeed with houses and greens around and many colorful boats on the water, though most of them were parked because it was not very late in the day yet. It was a cloudy day around November and the advent of fall made the scenery look awesome.

The Best of Amsterdam. This is the most beautiful of Amsterdam's canals, narrower and more intimate than the others that ring the city center, and the one with the lion's share of houseboats, particularly on the end near the Reguliersgracht, the confluence with which offers some of the world's best residential urban views. Don't miss it. And take a boat ride while you are at it.
Canal Boat Stay. We stayed on The Lune canal boat for three days, watched tours and private vessels float by, and had a genuine Amsterdam experience.
picturesque. Good place to walk around and enjoy the beautiful view of the canals. Also very picturesque during the night.
A must see, must visit, part of the city.. The main canal of the ring, with lots of beautiful buildings and excellent cafes and restaurants. Also the focus for the annual Canal Pride!

Beautiful and interesting. Amsterdam is so pretty, but this canal had a particular appeal as the impressive Westerkerk (church) can be seen most of the time and it makes a lovely photograph. Anne Frank house is also on this canal. Some nice, individual shops here too.

Amazing. Definitely a must see. Was absolutely breather taking especially at night. Could of stayed there all day taking it all in. Great for photography . and getting pictures for your memories of Amsterdam. Highly recommend!
Nothing special. Just another Amsterdam street/canal. Only claim to fame, is the Anne Frank Haus. Several cafes and bars ect along it's length.

Real Amsterdam. its a real amsterdam feeling, lovely canal and not too many tourists, Just enjoy a stroll of walk around and you can really feel whats so special about amsterdam. Its a really beautiful city with lovely canals.
Nice neighbourhood. To walk or visit on a boat, good for a coffee with friends. Nice spots for pictures at sunset! Quiet and relaxing, except on Pride festival!

Goregous Architecture, Doorways and History. A wonderful insight into the lives and culture of Amsterdam. Wonderful architecture and history,Ma very pleasant stroll. We happened to be there during the pride festival which was sensational,misery colorful and a real mix of people.

One of three main canals in Amsterdam. It is one of the three main canals in Amsterdam. It is quintessentially Amsterdam. The relaxing views and the gable of the buildings are what you picture when you think of this city. There are outdoor cafes and shops. So delighful

Largest/widest canal in Amsterdam. Beautiful canal to see and walk about. We watched the Gay Pride parade on this canal and also walked around it. Nice shops and restaurants and of course the canal itself is impressive.

quiet neighborhood site of the Gay Pride celebrations. This is a nice part of Amsterdam good restaurants mixed with small quaint shops. But during the gay pride celebration it gets too rowdy. Having said that it's a nice quiet place for coffee.
Pridestream 2015. Went here for the Pridestream. Simply amazing experience with hundreds of boats going through the canal with people all around cheering them.
Beautifully central. A beautifully, centrally located area. Has quite a few interesting cafes and restaurants. Leads to all the main shopping areas like Nine streets and Leiderstraat.
Shopping Haven. Lovely area for shopping , both cheap souvenirs, and more expensive items, as well as alleys with restaurants offering a variety of cuisines.

Cool Canal. Thought it was going to just be another canal but it is better than the rest! Go in the Jordaan area, it is nicer there than the lower parts. Watch out for people biking though they will run you over. My girlfriend said shopping is good and there are lots of pubs in the area too.

The canal of the ordinary people.. The most popular canal in Amsterdam. It is full of live in contrary to the Gentlemans Canal and the Emperors canal. Most popular part of the canal is the Jordaandistrict.
Once an area of the working class. Today the area where the yuppies are living.
lovely walk. lovely place to walk by and sit at, also if you follow it you can get from one side of the city to the other without leaving the road, makes it very easy to get lost and disoriented

If you like to shop, then you MUST visit here!!. I could have spent my whole time in Amsterdam in Prinsengracht and still not had enough time. What fantastic shopping of all different price ranges. BEAUTIFUL clothing everywhere!! I only had a short window unfortunately as my young boys were not too patient; however, the cool toy store in the area helped greatly while I could do some shopping. This is boutique shopping which I find way more interesting than the commercial shopping areas. I hope I can return one day!

Stunning!. Highly recommend wandering around the canal ring on foot, remarkably peaceful and beautiful architcture but watch out for those crazy cyclists! A canal cruise is a must do with several companies with varying prices setting off from the canal just outside Centraal Station.

Excellent street to stroll the canals. Have walked this street many times, and every time we do, we seem to notice new unique places to explore. Shopping, restaurants, bars, attractions...this is a great place to get lost if you don't know what you're looking for and just want to explore.

a must beeing in amsterdam. This is Amsterdam , the narrow Canals , all the houseboats and ofcourse the exciting waterfront. Its realy a Place , together With all the otther Canals you have to take the tripp on on the canalboats. Ofcourse by bice or by foot will also give you a great experience

Peaceful. Cycling around Amsterdam city is a lovely experience however we came across Prinsengracht, we however got to know later that it was actually called Princes canal.
They have love coffee shop and restaurants on either side of the canal for nice meal or a drink whatever the weather then demands, it’s just around the Anne Frank house.
Beautiful canal!. Great view, very fun to bike or walk along this canal. If you're looking for the traditional, picturesque Amsterdam you see in paintings, this canal is the perfect spot!

Excellent café's and bars. Go along Prinsengracht, towards De Jordaan area, a little further away from the city center; you'll find a number of nice bars, offering an excellent capuccino in a far less crowdy surroundings.
Beautiful area to wander around. Very pretty area with lots of photographic opportunities. Lovely Cafes for coffee. Interesting buildings.

Amsterdam is a great place - parks, restaurants and good transport such as the trams.. Would recommend anyone to visit the Amsterdam Forest, a nice day out with the family. It was fun to see so many pretty goats and chickens running around inside the enclosure while having a cup of tea!
A buzzing street with all kinds of shops. Loved the long street with a mixed array of shops to browse and also loads of coffee shops to chill out in and people watch

Beautiful and one of the most famous canals of Amsterdam, and described below are the best ways to take in the beauty. Just by walking, you will get to most of the famous canals(grachts) one after another. Prinsengracht is one such beauty. Generally bustling with tourists, on rare occasions when it is less crowded, you might enjoy the beauty more. See the passing boats below the bridge, or take pictures, or sit at an eatery beside the canal, or simply walk beside the canal aimlessly-all this will surely let you know why it is known as the Venice for this zone. Though not comparable to Venice, but surely it has its own charm.

Time to change. I think that Amsterdam as a whole is a really amazing city. Its canals have created the characterization as Venice if the north. With all due respect I think Amsterdam is just Amsterdam.

Great Area to Hang Out!. While the whole of Amsterdam is awesome, if you just want to hang out, stroll, people watch, or sit hand have a drink, this is the place! Beautiful canal, many interesting sites along the way, plenty of places to grab something to eat, and lots of places to grab a Heineken and watch people. Redundant, I know.
Dreamy in the evening. The 17th Century canal houses are like an outdoor museum. Although walking or cycling along this canal is a treat at any hour, we found it magical in the lingering summer dusk.
the lovely canal. it was beautiful weather and strolling along the Prinsengracht. Flowers a bloom, secrets gardens to explore, sites and coffee and of course Apple pie!
Simply Amsterdam. Block out a few hours in the afternoon and rent a bike. Cruise around Prinsengracht and absorb Amsterdam. So much fun!

Mesmerising beauty. If you are after peace and would like to read a good book or article then this is the place to head to. There is plenty of charged car parking available around this place. Just google for the addresses. Further, many were on the cycles and public transport is also available to come to this place. There are lot of places to eat, shop or drink around. The supermarket is just round the corner.
Pleasant shopping street with unique shops. Pleasant shopping street with unique shopsA break from the corporate behemoth stores, nice location & atmosphere, nice bars & cafes
My Street!!. I love MY street (actually only when I stay at The Pulitzer Hotel). Takes one everywhere one would want to go
Beautiful. Try to take a canal ride if you can--they're worth the price! beautiful weather and just a generally relaxing atmosphere. stunning views!

A Prince among canals?. walk down one side, then up the other -quite a trot but interesting to see the number of variations in architectural style in what is basically an exercise in getting the most out of the footprint available, largely upwards! Look at the doors (and buy a postcard to remind you afterwards) the size of the windows and if its dusk and there are lights on inside - the glorious and wide variety of the ornate plaster ceilings. Don't get so engrossed that you trip over the uneven cobbles, the sudden stairs for entrances to cellars (at 90 degree angles to the pavement, or the numerous floral containers or bicycles that festoon the railings and pavements.If you can get inside and though to the rear gardens, then do take the opportunity (the annual canal open gardens (June) is a passport into a hidden world! Enjoy!

Good for walking. Spent my afternoon here. Just walking around, eating some food. Enjoying the view and looking at the people around.
Nice to be here.

Great Street Ringing the City. Great street that rings the city - visit Cafe Molen Het on your way around for a cup of coffee or a cheeky glass of wine after a visit to Wester Kerk, Amsterdam Cheese Museum or the Anne Frank House.

True Amsterdam. Those channels (Grachts) are really something what make Amsterdam – Amsterdam. And this one is very beautiful, it connects also some interesting points in the city center – take a bike and just go.
open your eyes. nice and long canal with typical buidings. very representative of the "south canals" district of amsterdam
Beautiful. We really spent a lot of time in this area. Every street we turned down was just charming and gorgeous. I'd love to stay in this area in the future.
Cool architecture in a quiet neighborhood. What a great area in a great city. Quiet neighborhood, cool architecture, houseboats and of course a canal at every corner. Best of all very few bikes.
Buy the DK Eyewitness Travel Guide. I would recommend buying this travel guide just for the extensive section on the Canal Walk, which explains in detail many of the buildings along the 3 main canals

Take a Stroll and explore. This area is fantastic for everything that is Amsterdam (shops, food, architecture and just plain people watching). Just a meander up and down can be an experience. Get the feel of what Amsterdam is really about and don't forget to check out the skewed housing.

Nicest gracht in Amsterdam. We were so lucky to book a houseboot in the prinsengracht. It was the perfect place for our trip.
Prinsengracht has nice pubs, restaurants, coffee shops, anne frank museum and many more historic spots. Very good location. and nice neighbourhood

Nice to escape the mayhem. Escape the crowds and take a leisurely stroll along this canal.
Plenty of cafes and restaurants to break the journey along with quirky and unique boutique shopping,
See how many stuffed animals you can spot in the windows along the way.
Good for walk or a boat tour. One of the best canals - to be toured either on foot, by bike or from the waterside - by boat. Pay attention to houses decoration (and bikers)
Canal Hop-on-hop-off trip. The ultimate way to see the most of Amsterdam and get around. We travelled on Prinsengracht - it is also where the Anne Frank House is. So picturesque
The Heart of the City. Follow life at a strolling pace through some of Amsterdam's most historic neighborhoods. Just be warned of the bicyclists. They take no prisoners.

Love this Street :-). Personally, one of the most pretty Canals of Amsterdam...
Take a walk along the River and be amazed by its beauty :-)
Great canal walk. One of the nicest routes to walk along the Canal. However, almost every route you take is stunning, this one canal will not let you down!

Excellent canal, in most spots. If you are looking for a quiet spot to observe the city and enjoy a canal, the Prinsengracht is a good choice. Make sure you see the section north of the Anne Frank Huis, and south of De Wallen. The are between can become crowded with noisy tourists spilling out from the Red Light District. There are many quieter canals on the side streets, so don't be afraid to explore!

loved it!. My boyfriedtook me to Amsterdam for my birthday last July.Ithought this was a strange choice considering what Amsterdam is well known for we stayed close to the prinsengrachtand I just loved it we must have walked this strechover 10times andnever got bored every time we found new littestreetsleading offand the houses are beautiful iflike me you only know one side of Amsterdamdon't let it put you ofstay anywhere on this side of town and it will not disappoint!

Stunning and memorable Prince of Canals. If there is one Canal you need to visit in Amsterdam it would be Prinsengracht Its here you can view and appreciate some of the more wealthy character homes. Many years ago these homes were singely owned by one family with the servants living in the lowest level of the home - usually street level.
Great for walking. Not very clean nor well organised, but beautifull surroundigs, worthwhile to see. Houses of the past. Go there
cool road. you can feel the Flair of Amsterdam in this road. Many bars and also Shops you will find here. Come an see yourself - it's beautiful.
Ambling. This street is fantastic for shops, food and architecture. Just a meander up and down it is a whole days looking.

Prinsengracht: Super place to Wander About. We rented an old apartment on Prinsengracht and though we did not plan it so, the day after our arrival was King's Day. Super crazy 24 hour party. Our location and Prinsengracht in general was perfect for experiencing this. After the party was over, and the streets and canals cleaned up -- which they do quite well -- it was great to wander around without the crowds. The canals and buildings in this area are fantastic to photograph so take your time. Lots of good restaurants as well, including a very tasty Indonesian one not far from our apartment (Long Pura on Rozengracht).
Princely Pleasure. Love walking about this area and discovering hidden cafes, eclectic shops and generally just watching the barges as they go by. Calming for the soul.

Take time to stroll on Amsterdam's grandest canal. I wish we had started our adventure here, but better late than never. We found it after our tour of the Anne Frank House. The tree-lined canal is home to the flower market and is lined by some of the most beautiful narrow buildings so common to Amsterdam. Take the time for a stroll on the Prinsengracht or take a canal boat tour on a nearby canal. It's worth your time..

Love the Area. The children of this area is that it is close to the tour section but not so hectic and noisy. In fact it's quiet and peaceful and absolutely picturesque. Our hotel is right on the street and I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else.
Beutiful. Beautiful classic Amsterdam architecture on one of the most significant canals in the old city centre. Stunning houses and very peaceful to walk along by the water.

All the canals in Amsterdam are nice!. Take a canal tour on different canals (gracht). I took 2 and enjoyed seeing the interesting narrow buildings, each with a unique architecture, peering into all the houseboats, some with gardens and sculpture, some more like vacation homes, and some a bit run down. Close to fresh water, the canals are mostly clean and fresh. A few of the tours get out onto the harbor - make sure you do that! See the Nemo building, and the Central Station's bicycle parking that holds 2500 bikes! Holland is a great country to be outdoors, and enjoying Amsterdam from the canals is a great way to do it. Pick out a nice sidewalk cafe, where the all seem to have awnings, and sip you drink watching bike riders, boats and life!
Beautiful canal. We did it on a bike and walking, both are great, a must do in Amsterdam is to take a stroll is this area and take in the beautiful scenery.Don't visit Amsterdam without visiting here
Cute canal with lots of good shops. On Saturday there is a great open air market. Good bars and shops during the week. Very close to dam square. Great place to stay

Pretty Prinsengracht. We stayed in Prisengracht and it was truly delightful. From the window of our hotel we could see the graceful bike riders wiz by and the hub bub of the corner cafes and bar. It is definitely worth wandering through for its eclectic mix of shops and cafes. It also has a calmer feel than more touristy areas and the bars and restaurants we tried were all great.
Lovely - brimming with restaurants and artisan shops. Artisan chocolate, cheese museum little coffee shops - it has it all. Walk down it on your way to see Jordaans little streets

Perfect For Relaxing and Quiet Touring. Beautiful area in the west of the city. Great for walking or bicycle riding. You'll find the Anne Frank Huis over here as well as nice churches, the Houseboat Museum, lovely shops and many cafes to sit and enjoy the passersby both on land and canals.

Nice neighborhood. Loved walking around here...nice shops...people are friendly...all in all nice neighborhood. Bought cheese at a shop here and it was half the price than buying it from the main drag...
Unique. Breath taking experience! The more I stay, the more I love this city and people. Very nice canal view with ild architecture from 16th centry
Peaceful. Just beautiful. Very peaceful amid the hurly burly of the city. It doesn't feel rushed or chaotic. Well worth chilling out here.

Welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the City. Beautiful architecture, we took a boat trip meandering slowly along the canals, plenty of photo opportunities of these stunning buildings, very touristy I know but you have to do it even if just to get a different angle on the buildings. In fact we had been walking around all day and the sit down and rest while still sightseeing was a welcome relief. Lovely quiet area normally, lovely to stroll around with some local bars and restaurants, also very near to Anne Franks house. Always do this when we are in Amsterdam - one of my favourite places.
Good for Strolling. Anne Frank House located here. Lots of cafes and people watching can be done. Can also watch the canal tour boats float by.
Shops galore. loved just sitting people watching and the street artists were great, great food and lovely restaurants,

This area is a Unesco Heritage Site for a reason: fabulous. A walk along this canal (and others like the Keizersgracht and Herengracht) should be on all itineraries. Don't miss... this area is a Unesco Heritage Site for a reason.
Beautiful canal. Beautiful canal, definitely worth walking up and down. The Anne Frank Museum is on this canal and the houseboats are quintessential Amsterdam.

Like all the other canals. Nothing special, it was like all the other canals. There were some cute shops, and some cafes, but it wasn't as amazing as I thought it would be. I was very disappointed with how dirty the city was, and how grey and boring the buildings and surroundings were... it all felt grey and dull

A place to walk or boat by. Rented a pedal boat and we drove over this canal. It was a nice weather and we enjoyed looking at various buildings. There were also birds on the canal that had built nests and it was lovely to see the places they had built, such as a unused kayak! Must go for night photographers!

Peaceful, tree lined walk along the canal. We ended up here by mistake initially as we took the number 4 tram when we should have taken the 14. However, we immediately recognised that this is a recommended area to walk. It is indeed one of the prettier canals and not do crowded as others over by the Dam and in the Old City. There are many cafes to choose from and shops to visit. It is also nice just to sit by the water and observe life on the water.

AMSTERDAM WALKS. Prinsengracht area in Amsterdam is a most delightful PROMANAD alongside one of the many beautiful canals. you can sit down and relax and just take in the scenery and stop now and then for a cuppa Java and fabulous desserts and and also enjoy a typical Amsterdamer Beer or Dutch Brandy or perhaps lunch. It's very peaceful wondering around the Prinsengracht and the canals.
Beautiful Walk. We stayed in a hotel directly at the canal.From here we had beatiful walk in each direction and on one occassion we walked all the way to the Anne Frank House, just lovely!
A must in Amsterdam. Lovely area and a cracking canal. Good local shopping. Loads of bars and restaurants to choose from.

First place to visit!!!. Lovely streets, canals, lovely shops. It makes one feel what Amsterdam is. We stopped at some interesting shops and a cute little Stoop waffles museum. Felt like a very romantic stroll!!!
Beautiful canal in Amsterdam. The Prinsengracht canal has many stores and restaurants. Well worth a visit. Nice cafes which are great venues for people watching.
Beautiful walk along the canal side.. Have a look at the houses, they are all different! Take a boat along the canal, it is a pleasant perspective.

Nice street near the Museum. I had a great time at the museum and mulling about through the little alleys with stores, coffeeshops, cafes, and restaurants. I highly recommend it to any amsterdam travellers.

Patience required to enjoy this museum. The museum, as is generally well-known has been extensively re-modelled.It is truly world- class and although wevisited the New York Met Art Museum last month we preferred the Rijkssmuseum.The staff are very helpful and friendly - a bonus was the excellent restaurant. You will need several visits to do this museum justice .The guide book at €10 is tremendous value and full of scholarship.

this is where we are staying. so much to see and do, a very cool area..many nice little shops and good places to eat....great coffee shops Sweet Cup in particular and Lombardo's fort he best burgers !!

Historical street. Anna Frank House and museum I located on this street. We walked the entire length of the street from our hotel. Beautiful homes, nice restaurants and beautiful sight along the street. Amsterdam is a walkable city, otherwise rent a bike!

One of the most magical places.... Simply one of the most magical places in the world. I am not joking. I just LOVE this beautiful, calm, green, old, cool, historic, exciting gracht (canal).I used to cycle up and down Princengracht every day, often stopping for a coffee or to sit on a bench and relax. Such a beautiful place to hang out on...I highly recommend.
Enjoy this attraction on a boat. If you do not have plenty of time available for walking, enjoy a boat trip and you will have this most amazing views.

Great shopping. In the heart of Amsterdam, within walking distance from the hotel. All shops are there open all day long. The canal is beautiful and crowded. This is a must visit when you are in Amsterdam.
Every step is beautiful!. Like all of the canals on the inner ring this one is beautiful. To take any of them in properly, you must walk it on both sides. It's the only way.
enjoy a stroll. A lovely canal for a stroll. Plenty of shops, galleries and places to eat and drink line this lovely part of town.
Nice canal. Nice little canal to walk through and eat or get a drink at cafe. Lovely area with nice picture opportunities. Well recommended!
Best of the canals. Bohemian. Unique shops around the "nine streets". Luxury hotels nearby and some great and unique musea (one about the history of handbags, I believe)
What a lovely stroll. Walking by the canal, admiring the lovely buildings, the cafés. This area has such a lovely atmosphere. It cannot be missed.

This is the party canal. Friday & Saturday nights the canal is full of Amsterdamers & tourists with canal boats, drinking & music. If that's your sort of thing you will love it. It's a nice waking canal with many shops but I liked other more peaceful canals more
Highlight of Amsterdam, together with the other canals. If you don't have a lot of time, better to walk along the canals and like inside the curtainless houses than doing a museum...

Merchants houses from when Amsterdam was one of the richest cities in the world. This is the epitome of the wealthy merchants housing in old, central Amsterdam. You'll see these impossibly tall and thin houses with the hooks in the gable to lift the furniture up and through the front windows (because the3 stairs are too narrow). That method is still used today.
