LIke the Koningsdag in april or canal parade early august. The main cultural event is Prinsengrachtconcert, close to Westerkerk. End of august and enjoy an open air concert in the evening for free. Just be very early if you want to see anything and bring your own chair (with food and drinks to share with the people around you)
nice. go walking around the city. lots of nice photo opportunities. if it is nice and sunny. this is what this city is about

Rented a House Boat. Our decision to rent a house boat on Prinsengracht canal paid dividends. You can walk everywhere from there. We had not need of a car, the boat was moored right by the square where the organic market was held. We bought a two day canal boat pass and used it to travel the whole canal system. You can hop on and off. We sat in our boat with the doors open wide waving to the tour boats and feeding the ducks. It was one of the best short breaks we have ever had.

Beautiful. Simply beautiful. In Amsterdam, any canal looks the same to me. However, anything with water attracts me. Especially considering that Amsterdam is pretty unique than the rest of Europe, perhaps. Enjoy the walk. Take pictures. Sit at the nearest cafe, have a tea. Drink sparkling water. Do whatever you like. But just enjoy this moment in being in Amsterdam. This is one of the truest way to enjoy Amsterdam, if I may say so.
Beautiful Amsterdam. Any area but in particular the Prinsengracht is beautiful to walk around or visit the shops. A boat trip on the canal is also very nice. You'll enjoy your visit.
National heritage, great for a walk. Access to the 9 straatjes with it's boutiques shops and trendy people. Many places to pick up a sandwhich for around 4 euro's or have a cup of coffee.

lovely walk. enjoyed every minute strolling along prisengracht. whether you look to the historic canal houses or the tree-lined canal itself, everything's so lovely! i never seem to tire looking at the scenery.
One of the 3 main canals . Beautiful walk or bike ride to enjoy the scenery and while your there visit Anne frank museum. Truly a must. Great little cafés with nice coffees ;)

on a nice day. If the weather is good take a walk on any of the Canals including this one. You will experience the real Dutch way, stop and cross the bridges, stop and have a coffee, stop and take pictures you will not regret the experience. All this if the weather is good if not is is a hell of an experience, wait till the rain stops.

quintessential amsterdm. we had the pleasure of staying in an antique canal house during our recent visit to amsterdam. the canal itself is beautiful, lined with canal houses, shops and restaurants, not to mention the lively life on the can in houseboats, tours, and pleasure boats. we especially enjoyed people watching: everyone seemed to be in good spirit, with a fun, relaxed vibe.

WOW. My Grandfather lived here in 1934-1938 (at 905)It is peaceful yet a lot is going on, boats on the canal, walkers and cyclists, people watching especially good. A short walk to the UTRECHTSESTRAAT and there are excellent Bars (Bouwker and Café Mrcella). Don't forget to go to SIMON & EVERTS Fish store on the Bridge, it is sensational, especially as the new herrings are in, this is OH SO DUTCH. Opposite is another Bar "Under the Stork" andon the other corner a cigar shop. Going towards the AMSTEL there are several good bars and Cafes (Le Zinc et les autres) and Eetcafe le Fejs, Drink or eat beside the canal. The houses are stunning, old and interesting

Lovely place to kill time in nice weather. The Prinsengracht is one of the many beautiful canals that run through the centre of Amsterdam. Personally, I didn't find Prinsengracht to be any more appealing than many of the other canals that I had the pleasure to walk along, however this does not take away from the fact that it is still a lovely place to spend time itself. If you have an hour or two to kill, it's a perfect place to sit by the water with a bite to eat and watch the various boats pass you on the canal.
Amazing canals. Enjoyed tours of canals...all of them...amazing works...the houseboats and their landscaping was really pretty.
architectural delight. very central, in outer ring of canals, well-preserved homes from 3 centuries ago, lovely, unique homes restored to their original beauty and very well maintained

Great Eating and Shopping place. Its a wondeful experience walking along the street here with all the shops splendidly decorated and exhibiting their merchandise. There are many high end as well as budget shops.It is also lined with a lot of restaurants where one can enjoy his dinner.A canal ride can also enliven the whole experience.

Strolling the canal and watching the boats and happy folks. At around lunch time there was a little boat with a fellow and his trumpet playing music to the belfry of the church near Ann Frank House..I made a little. Idea of it...and laughed and smiled at all the amuses spectators...not sure how often the fellow does this...but so coooool...and then he yells ahoy and the crowd yells ahoy and the man in the bell tower leans out and yells ahoy back...
One of many special grachts. Though well known,still a "must" for all visitors to Amsterdam. Stand on one of the many bridges overlooking this waterway and escape the crowds around you.

A Beautiful Neighborhood. We rented a houseboat on the Prinsengracht canal for a week long visit to Amsterdam. This part of Amsterdam is both beautiful and convenient. It is close to the Central Station...about a 10 minute walk. However, by being there, you avoid the crowds and commercial aspects of the Central Station area. The Prinsengracht is home to a number of cafes and unique shops. We were in the area of the Nord church. If I am lucky enough to go back to Amsterdam, I am going to head back to this area.

Very Elegant, Upmarket Area. Princesgracht is a very elegant area, most people who visit Amsterdam come to this area as it contains amongst others the Anne Frank House which is a popular tourist attraction. What I like about this area is the tall gabled houses overlooking the canals and walking round the streets and drinking in the atmosphere.

From busy to serene. This canal area is a few miles long and changes completely as one approaches the Amstel River. Off Prisengracht is the museum area, the Ann Frank Museum and many streets leading further into the center city.

Beautiful canal!. We loved strolling along this canal. The apartment that we rented for our stay in Amsterdam was here so we experienced a long stretch of it! Lots of charming cafes, houseboats, houses...a nice place to experience the lovely city of Amsterdam.

Great streets on the canal. Lots of small shops hidden away amongst the houses. Great architecture Many old buildings from around the 1600's. Also the sight of Ann Franks house. Visit early as the crowds build up. Wait times can be over an hour.

Lovely Canal. Pity the cars are parked next to it rather than the pedestrian way, but with excellent bike paths and the need fir a footpath near homes I guess there isn't room for it all. Still a delightful canal to meander down.

Beautiful area. Prinsengracht is one of the main canals of amsterdam and this one truly is a delight to be around with its myriad spread of restaurants, the nice breeze and the whole view of the canal. Perfect for photographs and a good stroll over the place will brighten your moods instantly. I loved the whole atmosphere around the place.

A Firm Favourite. One of the most picturesque of the canals. Prinsengracht makes for an excellent wander with plenty of cafes, bars, restaurants and lovely shops to browse in. You can also stray from your path by taking one of the small side streets. Beautiful in Spring.
Wonderful. A walk along the canals is quite enjoyable. Looking at the architecture and enjoying the bridges. There are plenty of photo ops. A wonderful thing to do in a wonderful city.

The Prince of canals.. Probably the most popular of Amsterdams canals,marking the outer border of the centre of Amsterdam.It flows through some of the citys most charming districts,containing many impressive villas.It also contains the house of Anne Frank,and also the Amsterdam Courts of Justice.The hop on,hop off canal water buses are an ideal way of seeing the Prinzengracht canal.
Lovely area. Another lovely area of Amsterdam, a walk down the canal with all the boats and houseboats to admire is a pleasant way to spend a sunny afternoon.
Breathtaking views especially in the early morning. Discover the Golden century canals and houses. The best time is in the morning before the rush hour.
Best canal and street. Best canal and street lots to do with lots of good cafe, coffee shops and bars around it ...........................................................

Dreamy Amsterdam. The boat ride in a nutshell was dreamy. As we took the boat ride in the evening at 6pm, it was an interesting kaleidoscope of colours as you get the best of both worlds in terms of feast for the eyes. We started off at the boat stop near to the central train station and by the time we reached the canals, the sun was setting. As it was dusk, I started to feel a little sleepy (a little jetlagged) but what kept me awake and fascinated was at dusk every house was lit in their warm lighting. It was a dreamy experience peering into the rooms of the well-to-do.... a grand piano in what seems like a music room.... Many homes with a special reading room with a wall to ceiling library of books.... beautiful art deco pictures draped on every wall. It was almost as though Amsterdammers WANT people to see their rooms from the outside and everyone's competing to out-do each other! Nonetheless, I was really appreciating the effort that Amsterdammers take to decorate their houses. And of course, when the evening lights are on ... and you are sitting in a boat holding the hand of the man you love.... ah! Dreamy Amsterdam!! I couldn't ask for more :)
Amsterdam at its best. Love this area especially the Negen Straatjes / The Nine Streets: lovely boutiques and great bars. Really worth a visit!

Beautiful canal side. In Amsterdam they have three major canals and prinsengracht is one of them after Herengracht and Keizersgracht. The canal is right in the middle of the street yet gives a feeling as if you are walking through a beautiful countryside. The canal sides are beautifully spread with lots of restaurants, shops and cafés. The view is spectacular and some of the famous places like the Anne frank house are all in the vicinity.
Nice to stroll. All the channels are very beautiful, all are worth taking a stroll. Nice cafes, people watching, interesting stores.
Amazing venue. The absolut most romantic street I've ever been at. Full of cafés, restaurant, trees, small bridges, and everything is beautiful!
charming old Amsterdam. There are so many beautiful and elegant canal houses here. Walking along the canal is very quiet and it's hard to believe you're in the middle of a city.
Time for relax. Canals, houses, and cafes is here, and only sit down and enjoy and relax here.Take a look at the old houses here or fill the weather here when you join at the canals

Beautiful area. Canals, bridges, stunning houses, shops, coffee shops, cafes...this are has it all. This is the Anne Frank area also so there is a lot to explore. Also the Reypanear Cheese Shop is a must.

Perfect place to walk. Look for a nice cafe (there are a lot) to sit next to the canal and enjoy watching the boats go by. There are many canals and I got to a point in which all streets look the same. General recommendation for the city: get a bike, car parking places are expensive, the free ones are just a few and they're far.
Peaceful. Nice and peaceful area to hang out. Stopped here while on a tour, really like it. Not an area to drive in though, most of Amsterdam is congested, tight streets and expensive parking.

An interesting canal to visit. An interesting walk in the middle of Amsterdam. The bridges and houses are fascinating. The way the lean. The children were fascinated in the hoists at the top of each house. The house boats were varied. We took the canal bus later and the view from the canals around the city is worthwhile.
Happy. There are so many boats on the river during the King day. And everyone so happy and crazy. I t is a good time to visit Amstrerdam during King day, u will see another side of Ducth.

prinsen gracht one of the great Amsterdam canals. Nice the old canals in Amsterdam like the prinsen gracht showing the history of this city. Still a lot of watertraffic in these canals.All houses are build on "wooden palen" which are always below the water suface on top the the houses are build.
Beautiful row of houses and shops. Take a stroll up Prinsengracht, dominated by the impressively towered church and quaint canal bridges.

A beautiful canal walk. If you're looking for a great canal to walk along, this is a great choice! Beautiful homes, house boats and bridges make this a unique walk you'll be sure to enjoy. Stop at a cafe and enjoy a cup of coffee, outside if the weather allows.
A pleasant stroll. A lovely canal full of character, well worth 20 minutes of your time on a great spring day. No great highlights but just very relaxing.
Prinsengracht. Great canal to walk down - lots of shops, very charming. Tulip Museum and Noordmarkt flea market (Mondays when we were there) recommended. Jordaan area full of tucked away treasures.
Liked it. Quite and lovely street with becautiful canals. Possible to buy traditionla hering. Lots of restaurants with local beer
Go early. Beautiful quiet walk early on our way to the Noorden market. So peaceful and perfect for photos without the crowds.
Beautiful canal. Near Anne Frank house. Take a stroll along the canal. Note the variety of styles in the gables of the houses.
Wonderful walking in canal district. We spent our first day in Amsterdam just walking along the canals and enjoying the sites. This was an especially lovely canal walk.
Strolling. There are lots of shops and sights here. Certainly a place to visit and enjoy. This may be where we had that delicious pie.

Beautiful canal / street area. had a lovely walk down there and then ate in one of the best restaurants I have ev er eaten in the Vlaming Brasserie
Well worth taking your time to walk down there to see so many different sights and relax there too
Prinsengracht - good place for a scenic walk. Tram 5 and take a lovely walk to the Anne Frank Huis. Nice shops and cafes and the canal is very scenic.

Perfect Place To View King's Day Boat Parade. Not only is Prinsengracht canal a lovely area to walk it is also one of the best places to watch the "boat parade" on King's day. There were many vendors selling food, music, and lots of fun for all!
The best stroll. Off the most touristy track, still lively. Many individual small shops of all kind. Lots of places for a snack or a beer.

perfect place to stroll and loose yourself!. We arrived in Amsterdam this morning and spent a few hours walking around the streets. We loved walking around this area, checking out the buildings and canals.
If you're looking for a place to unwind which doesn't cost you anything - look no further. I believe you can also grab some of the boats for a tour here as well.

Great stroll. Being near to the 3 main canals of Amsterdam, we took a stroll along here a couple of time and this body is water is impressive.
Take a stroll and enjoy the surroundings!

Beautiful Canal that shows the life of the city. This Canal street was a part of our daily walk while visiting Amsterdam. It is so beautiful and peaceful, with lots of homes, shops, pubs and resturants right along its banks. So many parts of the city are connected to this canal street that it is a perfect way to experience the city. People watching is great along the many pubs on this street, you can check out the Anne Frank Huis and walk to the Jordaan and down to the Nine Streets as well. Also you can catch a canal ride along the canal as well. Great starting and stopping point, don't miss it.
Nice experience. Amsterdam is full of attractions and this is definitely a good choice. Very traditional neighbourhood in the heart of amsterdam

Beautiful Canal. My favorite area to spend time when visiting Amsterdam. For a great chill bar crawl on a sunny day, walk the west side of the canal between Browersgracht and Leliegracht. Bars like Papeneiland, P96, 't smalle, Spanjer en van Twist, and also Cafe Brandon on the corner of Leliegracht and Keizergracht, all have nice outdoor spots to enjoy the sun and canal.

Boat Ride. So this canal street has some very historic and old houses, ones that even lean. Here is where you can pickup a boat tour and see Amsterdam from the canal perspective. It is definitely worth the walk to this place even if you choose not to take a boat ride.The boat rides vary in duration and what they offer as far as food and such. And some even offer cover for bad weather days - which can be frequent in this city.
Lovely views of old homes. A beautiful walk along one of the most popular canals, with lovely period homes and shops along the way to make it just that more interesting.
Can't miss it. Very enjoyable walk. Lots of photo opportunities.Had a great time strolling around.Spent the rest of the day trying to pronounce "gracht" correctly :)
Lovely walk. Mooch along looking at the houseboats and gorgeous houses.a real flavour of Amsterdam.Explore the streets leading off the canal too.

An artery of Amsterdam. This is one of a number of major grachten (canals) that enable visitors to walk about Amsterdam and enjoy every moment! Have just spent a long weekend on a canal boat on the Prinsengracht, a superb experience.A great way to walk around Amsterdam is to head off alongside a canal, then take a cross lane to the next parallel canal, go down that one a way, then cross back or on to yet another canal. You get to see so much, a great mix of residential, businesses, shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.You can of course get a boat cruise that will take in this canal amongst many others.

Lovely area with great shops and restaurants. We spent a lovely April afternoon wandering along the canal and surrounding streets.There are some amazing fashion shops, including three Denham jean boutiques (brilliant jeans and clothing!!) and a lovely flower shop.We finished the day with a wonderful meal at Envy, which is very highly recommended.Enjoy !!!
Pretty neighbourhood. Just walk about and suck in the atmosphere, very pretty area with bridges, bicycles, and flowers along side the canal.

A lot of things to see at this canal. Visiting Amsterdam without seeing the "Grachten" (canals) is not compleet yet. A lot of beautiful buildings (houses) with different form of "gevel" (façade/ outside wall) are at the both sides of the canals. Prinsengracht is one of the main canals of Amsterdam, and the longest one. You can find small specific shops and cafes/restaurants along this canal. There are 3 churches are still used as a church, Noorderkerk, Westerkerk and Amstelkerk (on Amstelveld) and 1 church, "de Duif" is used for some events. The most famous events at this canal is "Prinsengracht Concert" and "Gay Pride". There is a flea market at Noordermarkt on Monday morning and an organic farmer market on Saturdays. Also Flower/ Plant market is held at Amstelveld on Mondays. The Houseboat museum is at Prinsengracht nr.296 , Amsterdam Pipe museum at nr. 488 and Anna Frank House at nr. 263-267
Beautiful Walk. A beautiful walk, so many lovely buildings to look at, and not too crowded. Just watch out for bikes.

Great. This is a fantastic place to visit, it really does sum up Amsterdam. You cannot miss walking round these streets along the waterside; just beautiful to stroll along siege. Boats passing, hundreds of bikes lined up, it is a place that you cannot miss.

Wonderful city walk. Princegracht along with the Herengracht, the Keisergracht and the Singel and such wonderful, peaceful and beautiful places to walk. The rich history of the buildings, the cobbled streets and the myriad of boats moored up are fabulous.

Good for a stroll. Nice area, easy to walk along and lots to see, just watch out for cyclists! The area looks very vast on a map, but actually the bridges are closer together. Also nice to jump on and off trams to take advantage of it all if your feet get tired.

Prinsengracht walking. Lucky enough to be staying on Prinsengracht I took a walk along the canal yesterday and it's charming and beautiful, and because it was early in the morning it was also a great view into the lives and morning routines of the local folks. If I can survive the crazy unpredictability and go anywhere attitude of the local cyclists I'm sure I will continue to love Amsterdam....a great way to catch a glimpse into the local lives...recommended

Definitely the cutest canal. This canal is my preferred as it brings calm, peace, and a relaxing atmosphere. I enjoy the small cafés on the other side from the Ann Franck house, and a little bit down the road, you may enjoy antiques and other specialities shops.It is a nice way to discover Amsterdam by bike, boat or walking.
A must-see. Very elegant and calm. One of the best canals. I recommend to walk along it and admire the architecture of the buildings and the trendy stores.

Beautiful place. Gracht means a canal.It is one of the three main canals of Amsterdam with few major destinations around it.Nice cafes and restaurants.Very green and nice houses to admire.A nice place to go for a stroll or take a few pics.Go for a boat cruise.I would recommend spending time in and around it.

Prinsengracht.. A nice place for a stroll and Anne Franks house is situated here.
Beautiful quite area with cafes and restaurants close by. Well worth a visit.

The loveliest gracht in Amsterdam. What can I say. We live on the Princengracht and we love it. It is a beautiful gracht in the centre of Amsterdam. A bit further away than the other grachten in the grachengordel, it is a bit more pleasant (though they are all nice). I like it because it seems a bit greener and friendlier than the other grachten in the centre.

Stunning. Absolutely beautiful - this is an absolute must do for any trip to Amsterdam. We strolled the full length of this canal just looking in all the various shops and stopping for coffees, cakes and pancakes along the way. Many of the houses are VERY open and have a small peek at the interiors is like reading a Homes and Gardens magazine. Classy, stunning and a must do.
Amazing boat trip. We rented a boat at Canal Motorboats and had an amazing time, specially the Prinsengracht.Amazing houses and houseboats, loved it.

Picturesque Prinsengracht. This is a wonderful area with all kinds of little shops. A good place to walk and take pictures. Our Hotel was right off this canal. This leads to many different shopping areas of Amsterdam. There are markets right off the street and several restaurants. A must see!

Stay on this Canal!. We stayed at the Pultizer Hotel on this canal, right by the Anne Frank house. I strongly recommend staying on this Canal. It is absolutely beautiful with so many wonderful cafes, restaurants, etc. to walk too.
Lovely Area to Explore. This is a lovely Area of Amterdam to walk round with lovely Cafes and old bars,Anne Frank house is here.

one of the best canals in Amsterdam. one of three most important canals of Amsterdam (Prisengracht, Keisergracht and Herengracht). i loved this spot! having a lot of cafes, hotels and attractions it's really fantastic.take walk around and also have boat trip, you'll enjoy.

My favourite canal "Gracht" in Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a city to walk. The central area with the streets that have the canals, called "grachts" are very nice for that.There are the Herens, the Kaizers and the Prinsengracht, the canal from the Prince, all of them are surrounding the main square, the Dam. They all have their own charm, for which is worthy walking around, but the Prinsengracht has in my opinion the most beautiful shops, antique shops and cafes.In any case, in the whole area, specially the region where there are the 9 little streets (9 straatjes), it's possible to find nice little boutiques with alternative stuff, nice cafes and restaurants the Dutch on their fast bikes.
great area for trendy more individual shops. this is a fab area for more individual shops; away from the mass chain stores! look for fab individual items that you will cherish!quiet and less trash!

lovely walk and pretty photo area. Took a boat tour and walked along. Very pretty area with nice shopping and restaurants. Would suggest taking the time to learn about about the history and structure.

Beautiful scenery, great cafés and vintage shops!. We spent almost a whole day walking along the Prinsengracht. At a teahouse, we had the amazing "Amsterdam Blend" and a wonderful carrot cake and brownie, we also spent some time in some of the numerous vintage shops along the Gracht. Also, try to visit the "Cheese Museum" (free entry, as it is more like a shop) and try some of the really good cheese varieties!
Nice city but.... I would say Amsterdam and the canals are nice, and it has the own charme, but honesty it is very dirty full with young turist gruops and the are always drunk during summer.
Nice place!. The canals were great! We had dinner in a small café and had lovely pancakes to top off the great meal. Staff were very friendly. Loved it.

Prinsengracht, Herengracht, Keizersgracht (Emperor's Canal) -- 3 Great Amsterdam Streets On Canals. The Prinsengracht, Herengracht and Keizersgracht are 3 of Amsterdam’s most famous streets located on canals within the city center. These 3 streets and canals are south of Central Station (train depot) and Dam Square. They radiate south and outward from Dam Square in a curved or convex pattern, akin to the 5 lower sides of an octagon. Large sections of all 3 are walkable in a morning or afternoon. The ambiance of the canals, the architecture, the bicycles, the people and the shops, bars and cafes are what Amsterdam is all about. They are the contemporary live museums of Amsterdam. If you are interested in how and when these canals and houses were built, and good stories about some of the people you know that lived in these houses, along with the history and culture of Amsterdam and its place in the world, then read Russell Shorto’s Amsterdam, a wonderful and inspiring book, that will also inform you about the roots of individual freedom and the great advances of the Enlightenment.
Beautiful and peaceful. Went to a museum here of an old house and loved the calm and peace. Great place to walk along. Just take in the atmosphere and look at all the different gables of the houses.

This gracht were so quiet and beautiful. An oasis in the Big city. This gracht had it all. Great food, cool shopping possibilities, a beautiful canal in the middle, and a lot of funny Strange canalhouses. We were happy that We were living at this street, Because it was so close to everything, and still quiet.

We'll stay on the Prinsengracht next time we are there.. Loved walking the Prinsengracht area. There's every kind of shop, café, museum, pub, market, gallery on this gracht. After getting lost in the Spuis area, was so happy to be back on "MY" street.

Beautiful Canal Tour. One can take a canal tour by boat along the Prinsengracht. We took one by 'See Amsterdam Cruise.' The captain was friendly and helpful, and the trip we took was during sunset, which made the whole place look magical.
Beautiful. Take plenty photos! I loved this spot :)Take a walk during the day and later at night. Picture opportunities around the corner.
Beautiful canal. Beautiful canal with many interesting shops and cafés along the way. Especially pretty in autumn with tress colours.
Lovely in June. We stayed in a houseboat on the Prisengracht. Lovely neighborhood with fabulous restaurants and a wonderful farmer's market. Highly recommended.

Amsterdam as on the postcards!. All the "Grachten" are beautiful. The city centre has such a diversity of periods and styles that it could almost serve as an open-air museum. Make sure to wander around and get a little lost, which is a good thing here :-)

It's better on foot. I saw a few boat trips running here but decided to walk as we were only there for the day. A few of the trips lasted for up to 2 hours or more so I didn't want to waste a day.You can enjoy it a little more on foot too and it's one of the less 'smoky' areas so you can breathe easy as you stroll around.A definite spot for your tourist pictures - it's a real slice of classic Amsterdam.
Beautiful. Beautiful canal for boat trips with interesting architecture and boutiques and cafes. One of the nicest areas of A'dam

The longest canal in Amsterdam.. The "prinsengracht" is the longest canal in Amsterdam! Here you can find several good hotels and the famous, Anne Frank House! From here everything in the center from Amsterdam you can reach by walk or with public transport.
Lovely. I walked and walked around Amsterdam for a day. The canals were all amazing to me. They are right around many shops and cafés...I just love Europe!
great shopping. lots of shops with great buys well worth a visit lovely to just walk about window shopping but good buys as well

Even when I didn't know where I was going, I seemed to find myself back in this area.. Nice area with plenty of shops, bars, restaurants. A variety of activities. Near the central station. Good area to explore.
Prinsengraght walk. very interesting with different decorative houses and buildings - went in winter but it was still picturesque

Beautiful postcard view of Amsterdam. Prinsengracht, known as the Princess Canal in English, is one of the three (man-made) canals that make up the canal belt of Amsterdam. The streets are lined with warehouses; you can recognize the warehouses by the simple (aka non-decorated) hooks on the top section of the houses. The other two canals; the Gentleman and the Emperor, are mostly lined with housing for the rich. So although the houses on Prinsengracht will not be as pretty as the other two canals, it is certainly a nice place to stroll down for a walk, especially at night. Furthermore, Anne Frank house and the Tulip Museum is within close vicinity. I had the pleasure of staying in one of the houseboats on Prinsengracht during my visit in Amsterdam through couchsurfing. The view is particularly stunning (and you can find this on many postcards) during the night when the nearby church (Westerkirk) and bridges are lighted up. Highly recommended if you want to take photos or just take a breather (it's the furthest canal of the three from the city and hence much less crowded).

A Must. Walk along in this area its the best in Amsterdam in our eyes!!!Lovely shops,cafes,and bars very peaceful full of charm.You will wonder and find something to suit everyone.!!!!!!!!!A MUST !!!!!!!!!!!!

Typical Postcard View of Amsterdam. One of the canals in the ring in Amsterdam, it is picture postcard as you imagine the city to be, canal, bridges, trees, bicyles, cobbles, traditional Dutch tall narrow, gabled buildings, shops, cafes and the famous Westerkirk and Anne Frank's house. The whole area is brought alive in Anne's diary so good to see the area from a historical perspective as well. Lovely to amble along or view from a canl boat trip.
Great walk in Amsterdam. Walking along this canal is a good way to live and discover Amsterdam. Great pictures to take. Simple and beautiful.

It's a canal !!!. So what's remarkable about Prinzengracht. Not all that much really. It's one of the major canals in Amsterdam's inner canal ring. There are many bridges from which you can take picturesque shots. Lots of buildings along Prinzengracht are both historic and well worth a snap or two. If you take a canal tour in the many, very comfortable boats that offer tgis service, you will almost certainly spend quite some tome on Prinzengracht.Having said that ... hey, it's a canal!!

Enjoyable walk, pleasant architecture. One of the nicest canals to walk along in AMS. Simple architecture, great colors and some small gems of bars and cafes along the way. Altogether with herensgracht, a nice way to stroll.
Old and new all in One. Beautiful shops, nice restaurants, pleasant streets to walk with magnificient old buildings.There's a lot of restaurants too

Could wander for hours!. Even if you aren't looking for something in particular to do, you will come across something here! We wandered around for ages, constantly finding small museums, boutiques, bars and restaurants.
Beautiful Amsterdam. One of the best places to stroll around in the city, beautiful canals, houses leaning against each other, great little shops and restaurants. Love it

Windy Amsterdam. Nice city but visit Amsterdam only in summer . We made a mistake to go thee in April cause we wanted to go to keukenhoff also but the chill and cold weather and the wind didn't let us enjoy t

Photographer's Paradise. A beautiful street to stroll along and a beautiful canal to boat down. Lots of little shops and cafes to stroll by and very safe. We've strolled down the Prinsengracht at 11:30pm after a concert at the Concertgebouw. Remember to look up at all of the beautiful canal houses. Those houses with wooden shutters were former warehouses - with living quarters on the ground floor and warehouse space on the upper floors. Be sure to stay on what little sidewalk there is or you may be side swiped by a bicyclist - they come from all directions. Also watch your step for "presents" left by family pets. Many unique bicycles parked along the canal and on the bridges and a few antique cars. You'll also see some interesting house boats.

Quiet and Charming Place to Shop and Stroll. It is a very safe and quiet neighborhood. Many chic design shops, restaurants and cafes. It is a bit like Venice but a cleaner and more modern version. Great place to stroll along and to shop. The Christmas lighting makes it even more charming!

perfect place to stroll. the prinsengracht is the outer ring of the four main canals in amsterdam. great place to stroll with quality restaurants, nice wine bars, quaint little design jobs and amazing buildings
Charming quarter. For me the more charming canal in Amsterdam, beautiful houses, nice shops. I love the jordaan zone in this canal.

Sunny December. We were so lucky with the weather so walking along the canal was a treat. Shopping is great with a wide range of little shops, funky clothes and glasses to waffles and pancakes. The tall old style houses on the canal are so iconic and the mix is very European. Nice to sit in a coffee shop and watch the interesting people walking on by. Amsterdam is a wonderful city.

Everything and more. We took the #5 tram. Once we were off the tram, the shopping began. There is every type of store and almost every big name is represented. Lots of people, be patient and just wander. Stop for a latte or beer or perhaps an olliebollen.If you don't want or need to shop, than just go for the sights and sounds.

Lovely walk especially for an American staving off jetlag. Walked along the Prinsengracht from our hotel, Hotel Fita, in the Museumplein area. There's nice cafes overlooking the canal. One we ate a late breakfast with a great view to see the canal and pedestrian traffic; good omellettes and mint tea. There is a gift shop with Delft ware; the Winkel 43 with supperb apple tart (apple tart is an Amsterdam specialty). And of course there is the Ann Frank Museum. Look at my comments for Hotel Fita and the Ann Frank Museum for hints on getting the Museumkaart and making prior reservations for the museum to prevent incredibly long waits--saw the lines wrapped around the block.
so easy and enjoyable. It is easy to walk along the canal with plenty to see along the way: houseboats, houses, shops. The weather was mild and sometimes sunny in December which really helped.

Beautiful canal. A really nice walk if you have a spare hour, lots too see, beautiful houses and houseboats. Lots of historical sights, places and museums to stop off on the way, from Anne Frank House to a cheese museum. Lots of quirky little shops and nice places to see.

Charming neighborhood. The Prinsengracht canal is in beautiful, upscale neighborhood with many historical sites. Lovely houses, houseboats on the canal, and side streets to walk through. Great location for interesting restaurants, too.

Toy Town. My "rough" expectations of Amsterdam diminished when I got there. The city is lined with many canals which reminded me of something out of a story book. Noddy or something. It is really quite pretty- oh and EVERYONE rides bikes. I love that about Amsterdam.

An interesting walk. A canal walk that takes you from one end of the city round to the other. Go through different areas and see a variety of building styles. Always interesting with something to see.

One of Amsterdam's 17th century canals. Prinsengracht (named after the Prince of Orange) is one the main canals that ring the centre of this beautiful city. The houses, originally home to wealthy merchants are of typical architectural style and the frontages are particularly picturesque. There are a number of notable tourist attractions on the canal banks, including the Anne Frank House, Gay Monument and the impressive Westerkerk, which dominates the local landscape. Prinsengracht is ideal for a pleasant stroll through old Amsterdam, but watch out for the bikes!
Gorgeous!. We had a beautiful walk along the canal on an early Sunday morning in November. So quiet, really a great way to experience Amsterdam on our first day there.

Why is this an attraction. Its a nice canal, with construction blocking one side for a bit, but why is this a destination or something to even mention. Its like saying Park Avenue in New York. I nice street with nice buildings but I don't get why its listed here as someplace to visit. Now the "Nine little streets" in the Jordaan is worth walking around. Our hotel was on Prinsengracht. The Anne Frank Huis is on Prinsengracht, but it doesn't matter, you would see the Anne Frank Huis anyway.

There are so many picturesque canals in Amsterdam. And to me the Prinsengracht is not even the most idyllic.For me the older canals are more attractive, like by the "Zuider Kerk", the Raamgracht and the Groenburgwal, although you will not see the very expensive "heerenhuisen".Also the Ouderzijds Voorburgwal with the "Oude Kerk" and the "Our Lord in the Attic" is an impressive sight with so many old "gevels" on top of old buildings.Having said that, it is a beautiful way to walk between the "Leiden Square" (Leidseplein) and the Anne Frank House.
Prinsengracht - A Lovely Neighborhood. We stayed at the Andaz Prinsengracht and loved the neighborhood! It was quite and convenient and lovely to look stroll through, even on rainy days.

Beautiful Canal. Great area to walk up and down filled with wonderful small shops and restaurants. It begins the are of 9 Streets which should not be missed. Each time you walk one of the streets, you noticed something you missed the first time.

Prinsengracht - The grandest Canal among others.. It is on good location near Ann Frank House, Houseboat Museum, Tulip Museum, Cheese Museum and West Church. Enjoy the boat trip or just a mere walking along the canals. A lot of bicycles parked everywhere, a lot of people just strolling around. There are lots of boathouses, canal houses, shops and coffee shops. On some occasions, this is a place where they held a concert, or any special occasion where people meet and celebrate. This is the grandest canal among others and it has historical value in Amsterdam where it served as way of transportation. Yes, it is old but it serves a purpose.Recommended to see and visit with out spending a penny.(Visited June, 2012)
quite walk.... If you wish to see Amsterdam`s quite side and architecture , this is really nice place to walk and enjoy 17-18th centuries architecture.

Beautiful canal. We did an hours touring up and down the canal in a rented boat. Being so low in the water you get to look up high at the architecture towering over you. If it wasn't for me being with a load of drunk lads on a stag party then it would have been a bit more romantic!

Urban nature. A gracious gesture of space & scale - conducive to slow walking and contemplation. The many small details - historic canal houses, barges, boutique hotels and shops - best experienced by foot. Find an open bench and let the world unfold around you.

walk around. It is a nice area to walk around, crossing the brides and canals (if its in a good weather), you will get a true look at Amsterdam. there are many coffee shops, restaurants and stores around the area as well.

We stayed here. Stayed with friends living in a third floor apartment here. I think Amsterdam is one of the most beautiful European cities I have been to and the view across Prinsengracht one of the nicest. Love it.

Quiet side of A'dam. We like to walk along the 3-grachts , criss crossing the bridges and canals in between. Definitely a great pleasure in good weather; you can also cycle. Loads of neighbourhood pubs, coffees, restaurants; far away from the touristic places. It has a much more "local" feel to it.

Fantastic canal in the heart of Amsterdam. Walking down the Prinsengracht, you get a true look at what Amsterdam is famous for. Lovely, picturesque homes line either side of the canal with small cafes and shops in between. The tree lined streets are quiet and peaceful with a small boat drifting by on the water every now and then.It an absolute treat to walk along the quaint streets and experience the locals going about their daily life. An absolutely fantastic canal to stroll down, you won’t be disappointed.

Beautiful canal. Walk along this stately and beautiful canal. But be wary of fast and quiet cyclists!There were different geese and ducks in the canal water -- some of the ducks were all black with little white bills. There was hardly a houseboat parking spot to spare! Some of the houseboats are really waterlogged. None of the boats were being used as it was cold outside (end of October)

Beautiful Canal area. Find a room in one of the private homes. Ours even had a kitchen, and private entry. Staying in this section of Amsterdam is the only way to go, tons of restaurants within walking distance. Watch out for Bikers, they are Kamikaze.

Beautiful place for a stroll and pictures. Gives a great feel of Amsterdam.. I absolutely loved it. Its where the Anne Frank House is.I highly recommend that you go there.Gives a feel of Amsterdam. I loved it.There is nothing much that I can write about it. Spare a couple of minutes to scroll through the pictures of this place and you would surely not want to miss it.

Great area for a stroll. We walked about Amsterdam and found this particular area to be very nice. We had good weather, so there were lots of people out and about and we enjoyed people watching and looking at the boats/homes lined up along the canals. We did not specifically seek this area out, and there are a couple of areas close by that are similar, but we did enjoy our time along the Prinsengracht canal. If we had spent more time in Amsterdam, I am certain we would have managed to get to this area again for another walk.

Location is awesome. I had the luck to visit this place soo many times, one of the easiest canal belt to get to right away, i mean just take west from central station, a 5 minute walk will take you to the belt, what is the best with this place is all the lovly buildings, bushes, roses, and also plenty of seats to sit down and relax and enjoy. Summer is the best time, there is kind of dampend down lights at night and a bit spookey and dark, but so enjoyable. true lovly is the word.I have also visited this place in winter time, autum time. Winter time can get so cold and dreadfull, the difference is that you just end up diving inside in the many cafes, and shops along the way to reaheat yourself and once more dive outside.Princhengracht, recommended!
Classic Amsterdam. When you picture Amsterdam you probably imagine scenes from here. Prinsengracht is one of the major canals in Amsterdam. A canal boat trip is an absolute must in my opinion.

beauty. this is a place of pure beauty, when its night and all lit up, in summer its still warm, its perfect for a romantic walk along the river. it is on most streets and the boats and things on the canal make it glorious. you see all the old style houses, had i known i wish i had taken a boat tour. its gorgeous.
Beautiful area. Take time and walk this beautiful street. In my opinion, the prettiest with the canals and houseboats.

Classic Amsterdam - Beautiful!. Prinsengracht is one of the primary canals in Amsterdam. You cross it frequently when walking in Western Amsterdam/Jordaan area. Basically it shows of the classic beauty of the canals and rowhouses in the city. Definitely you want to see this canal when you can.

What a great Place for a Canal Boat Ride. We loved the Canal boat ride around the Prinsengracht from the Anne Frank Huis over to Amstel Canal and the drop off at the Opera house. So peaceful and the bridges and houses are fantastic. A great price for the ride too. Worth seeing these and walking from there to cafes and restaurants.

Amsterdam Canal Cruise. Prinsengracht is one of the multitude of beautiful canals in Amsterdam. If you do a little pre tour reading and find out the who - where and when of this magnificent area you will enjoy the canal boat trip even more. Find out about where Rembrandt lived as a child and who were the people who financed the privateers in the Caribbean. What a remarkable place this must have been in the 15 and 16 hundreds.

Picturesque!. Amsterdam is truly a very unique city, and personally I believe it's predominantly due to its countless canals... they give the city such character! The Prinsengracht is quite impressive and anybody can appreciate its beauty, so any trip to Amsterdam should include a stop here.

Be brave - hire a bike!. We had a great time in Amsterdam on our 35th Wedding Anniversary trip. A very beautiful city, full of things to see; food to eat; great coffee. Art; Music - some amazing street musicians! One of our highlights was hiring a bike for the day - it took some courage, but turned out a lot more straightforward than we anticipated for two reasons: (1) The bike is 'king' in Amsterdam - everything else has to give way including pedestrians. (2) The locals were very forgiving if you made some mistake - e.g. stopping instantly because you forgot back-peddling was the brake. Perhaps it helped too that the bikes were lime green. But wonderful to cycle through the Vondelpark, stopping at cafes for refreshment, on the way to see the Stedelijk Museum 's collection of modern art. Sunday, we went to Hillsong Amsterdam, the contemporary worship church. Slightly out of the town centre, it allowed us to discover the great tram transport system; and great to see first hand how Hillsong, a modern church community, does things.Very slick; very welcoming; and the ubiquitous good coffee of the Netherlands. Four services every Sunday each with over five hundred attendees. Sigh!

Beautiful. It's a beautiful canal - one of the highlights of any trip to Amsterdam. A lot of people will confine themselves to the red-light district and come away thinking Amsterdam is a sleazy city. Anyone who ventures out to see the canals couldn't possibly agree.
Anne Frank House. A lovely area, be sure to visit the Anne Frank House whilst there, book on line before you visit to avoid the queues
Take the time. Take the time and enjoy walking on both sides of the canal. Don't look up too much, you'll either get a crick in the neck or be run over by a cyclist.

Saturday market on Lindengracht is wonderful. This area is full of beautiful canal streets, ideal for strolling. In addition, we were lucky to stumble upon an outdoor market on a parallel canal street, Lindengracht, which runs on Saturdays until 4:00 pm. We had fresh herring for the first time. Really, really, tasty! Any varieties of other freshly made food too. It was a very happy atmosphere. If you are around on a Saturday, put this in your plans!
At ease in the Prinsengracht Jordaan area. It is just a homely Amsterdam touch. Just breath in the ambiance and unify with with it, become one and you may not want to leave.

the essense of Amsterdam. Four circle shaped canals surround the old town and Prinsengracht is probably ther most popular, with beautiful facades to all its extent. It is also a great place to watch big events - Amsterdam Prinsengracht concert and Gay boat pride event.Staying in a hotel in Prinsengracht will give you that special old Amsterdam feel and all the attractions a re within reach
Lovely stroll. It's lovely strolling along the canal, especially on a sunny day. Lots of people, bikes, small shops. Lots of well known places within walking distance.

The best of both worlds. We were fortunate enough to stay on a house boat on Prinsengracht itself - and I must say it was one of the most harmonious holidays ever. Prinsengracht is at the same time in the middle of the action, close to everything and peaceful and quiet. Tons of cozy cafés, restaurants a small shop scattered in between the classic dutch canal houses on Prinsengracht and the adjacent streets. The narrow canal street keep (car) traffic to a minimum, but watch out for the plentyful bicyclists. The easiest way is to become one your self - it is by far the best way to experience the city.

Great Atmosphere at Day or Night. Both during the day and night the Prinsengracht, bordering the Jordaan is a wonderful place to stroll and take in the special atmosphere that Amsterdam has to offer, away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. Make sure you make time to stop in one of the cafe's or browns bar's.

Stunning to walk along. I was located at a Hotel next to this Canal, the sightseeing is beautiful, great to relax next to while watching all the Canal cruises pass by. Very peaceful and definitely worth visiting, with views that are picture perfect. Most of time being busy, with lots of cyclist and visitors to the Anne Frank House. Amsterdam is an amazing City and this street gives it a star attraction
Lovely area. Our last night was spent at the Andaz on this lovely street right on a canal. Walking distance to so many places, it is a still quiet and very pleasant,

Charming, exciting, independent design. This is the quintessential European walk: sunlight dappling through trees onto the canals, and every block or so another remarkable "find": artisanal leather bags, art supplies, independent clothing designers, pop-up shops ... Must-stop: Frozen Fountain, a wonderful design shop.
Great street. The Prinsengracht is a picturesque, almost quaint street along a wide canal in the wonderful Jordaan neighborhood. Just walking its length is a great time.
Lovely!. Good to wander along ! Flowers on bridges make it even better. Went to market at the North end .Enjoyed coffee and snack sitting out "people watching"!!
A lovely stroll. On a good weather day it is a wonderful walk peppered with boutiques and eateries as well as boat viewing.

Walk along the canals, but please avoid the pushbikes.. Saw it first from the one hour Canal Tour we did. It takes a while to adjust to the different traffic forms, and where they are coming from, and where they are supposed to go, and where you are supposed to go!
Strolling around Amsterdam. Really nice area to walk around. We enjoyed walking everywhere! We walked to the Rijksmuseum and around the Jordaan area.
A beautiful place. Do have a walk along the Prinsengracht when you visit Amsterdam ii has some very interesting and beautiful buildings along the sides of it.
Great area, good sites. Definitely rent a bike and go up and down this street. Cool sites and good restaurants. Try to hit up one of the many street markets too!

the Prinsengracht. This was my favorite canal/street. Very charming and full of interesting shops and restaurants. I was there for the final concert of the festival, and to watch the canal fill with boats anticipating the concert was amazing. It's a good time.

The long canal. We rented a houseboat on Prinsengracht, in the south by the Amstel. Good place to stay as its quieter than the more central canals. Handy for Museumplein and Albert Cuyp. bit of a walk for Dam Square, but we didnt want to be close to the madness. There are some lovely restaurants and cafes along this canal, many beautiful canal houses and of course some interesting houseboats. Look out for Rajpootana, the blues houseboat with the stained glass windows.

A very beautiful area!. A very beautiful canal but no place to walk and enjoy it. Cars and bicycles parked everywhere from canal to building. No sidewalk on the canal side of the street with cars and bikes parked with to the canal edge. Barely one on building side and that usually had bicycles park on it.

A lovely area to walk. We had to wait a bit for our allotted time at the Anne Frank Huis so we walked around the Prinsengracht neighbourhood. What a lovely area to walk in especially in autumn. Even with the crowds at the Anne Frank Huis, the neighbourhood was peaceful and pleasant. We had a delicious bagel and hot chocolate next door to the Anne Frank Huis.

Beauty surrounds you. Take a walk down this canal - you will be richly rewarded. Everywhere you looks is stunning. There are many little independent shops and bars. We had to keep stopping at the many pretty bars alongside of the canal - its a hard life! Great food and beer, wonderful architecture, lovely people - what's not to like?

Lovely area in A'dam!!. So many nice shops, cafes and great atmosphere. Great area to visit on a sunny afternoon, with friends, family or solo. Typical restaurants, trendy shops and delicious ice cream parlour too!

Lovely restaurants with outdoor seating. The area is clean and overlooks the canals. My friends and walked all over the place without problems of getting lost. Make sure to bring a map with you as the entire Amsterdam has so many alleys and streets.
excellent. Very beautiful trip and it is nice to do it twice,one day trip and the other night trip.You can closely watch where the locals live and you can watch boat houses.

VERY INTERESTING STREET IN JORDAN AREA. You definitely want to wander along this street. The canal flavor and the shops are enjoybable. There is a famous church Westerchurch, were Rembrandt is buried.

We heard/saw a concert on the Prinsengracht. What an amazing surprise. To see/hear a concert on the canal. It seemed like the whole of Amsterdam turned out. The canal itself was full of boats and people, the streets around it as well. IF there is a concert on any of the canals when you are in Amsterdam, you MUST attend. You will remember this for a lifetime.

Canals at their best. This sums up what we all imagine when thinking of Amsterdam. Wonderful bridges and lots of old properties. Check out how some houses lean at impossible angles and some are built intentionally leaning forwards. This is to facilitate hauling large objects, furniture etc up from the street and in through windows as the stairs in Amsterdam are mostly too narrow!

Great for scenic walks and lunch al fresco. We were in Amsterdam for a week. We enjoyed walking this canal. It is very pretty, lots of fun shops and restaurants. Overall, not to be missed-great way to chill and enjoy the culture at the same time.

Spend some time exploring this canal. to truly experience Amsterdam put on a good pair of walking shoes and explore this canal, there are pretty views at most corners, and funky art galleries and cafe's along the canal that you can stop in to explore

What a wonderful part of Amsterdam. To stroll down the Prinsengracht canal has to be one of the great pleasures on visiting Amsterdam. All the old monument houses, the flowers, and boats passing are unforgettable.

Worth a stroll. Walked south along the western bank from near the Anne Frank house to Leidsestraat. Able to views a series of quaint canals with trees, houseboats, lots of flowers, etc. A relatively quiet area with a number of individual businesses including some interesting shops. Good for getting away from the throng and seeing backstreet Amsterdam.

A Romantic Walk. A gorgeous street to walk down taking you though various parts of the city. wonderful place for photo opportunities or to have a drink at some of the bars or restaurants dotted along the road

A lovely street!. very lovely to walk and stroll on this block in Amsterdam... a good walk is to travel this way from Leidesplein area up to the Central Station. Stop for a Pancake at the Pancake Bakery right after you visit The Anne Frank House.

The "polite" Amsterdam. Try the pubs and the bar of this area! Beautiful during the night with all the lights on! In this area you can find the Casino, in which in not required a formal dress code, and the Hard Rock Cafè!
Quiet part of town. Close to West Church, the people are friendly, the restaurants are reasonable and it is beautiful. The canal side pubs are the best!
Lovely. A buddy of mine and I spent a few hours sitting on this canal to watch the annual Gay Pride Parade. It was very nice, shady and a great place for the parade!

The classical peoples Concert of the year. Every year there is the Prinsengracht Concert a absolute must see must experience and must have been there attraction of the very "first order" and .. music to the people be it the restaurant server or the Phd and anybody socially in between this is a "must see, must be and must hear event" Unique in the world ! Get or rent yourself a small "sloep" boat and get up to the orchestra stage by boat. So ladies and gents classical music lovers book your tickets for next year I enjoyed and sucked it all up last night. for the complete yesterdays event just view: http://avro.nl/prinsengrachtconcert/Have fun enjoy the happy people of the Netherlands !
So beautiful. Beautiful walk along this canal. Outstanding photo opportunities. Many nice places to eat, and worth spending the time to just sit and watch the canal tourist boats drift on by.
great place. This area is one of the best things to amsterdam. I would always want to spend as much time as possible in this lovely ambience.

This is Amsterdam!. It has everything Amsterdam is known for except the Red Lights! Beautiful views, shops, restaurants and some museums. Great for strolling and eating. Less crowded than some of the high traffic areas.
It's amsterdam.... What i expected from this city is in there. Go also at nightfall and enjoy a drink in a terrace beside the canal.

canal of life!. Such a pretty canal, full of people wandering, wonderful and pretty flowers and a feeling that life is what it is here. This can creates calm in the minds of the people near it. Canal of life - for everything in its midst! Will return again. We could have spent all day here.

Life by the Canal. Was there accompanied by a tour group, everything was in a hurry. Was unable to roam around the canal much due to lack of time. Went for a boat ride & the picturesque was amazing. Life by the canal was serene with some of the wealthy prefer to stay in their small & narrow boathouse.
charming and picturesque. This street is the essence of Amsterdam: charming and picturesque. Windowboxes overflowing with beautiful flowers, friendly people, charming little shops and cafes.
Walk it from end to end, then travel it by boat. This is the nicest canal in Amsterdam with major attractions and markets alongside and some of the best neighbourhoods and shopping adjacent.

Lovely place and nice atmosphere.. I was staying at the hotel not far from the Prinsengracht, a unique place of its kind, it was a pleasure to visit it during the day but especially at night with its lights that make the atmosphere very romantic.
The Canal is gorgeous, crossed by uncountable boats, I could sit all day to admire this beauty.

Great!. Fab shops! Central location! Trams go straight down it! Beautiful views over canals. You do have to be careful down the main street though of the trams, they don't tend to like to stop if you walk out in front of them they just beep!

The busiest of the 3 ring canals. What can one say about a canal? There is lot's to see on this one. The Dutch love their boats and love to float lazily down the canal, usually with a beer in hand. This canal is great for people watching. Lots happening on either side too. Many outdoor patios, Anne Frank Huis, Wester Markt and Noorderkerk market nearby. Prinsengracht is the main streat of Jordaan!
Take a Ride. Took an evening boat ride very enjoyable gave us a nice feel for the city shortly after arrival. Glass top view lots of photo ops
Pride. Best Pride parade in the world. Beautiful canal to have it on, and it really is a celebration for the entire city!

A stroll through history. After visiting the Anne Frank house, I continued on down the Prinsengracht, stopping to visit churches, shops, and a cafe. It's one of the most charming parts of Amsterdam, and judging by the vast number of visitors, it's no secret!

typifies Amsterdam. This is one of the most archetypal canals with merchants houses each side. The great thing about these houses is that they are all different but of a similar height, so there is the charm of a terrace but also of variety. There is a narrow strip of land between the houses and the canal (unlike Venice) which are busy with tourists and cyclists.
Great by bike. Picture postcard Amsterdam - even better by bike. Bridges, canals and wonderful eating and shopping opportunities.

Beautiful and romantic Prinsengracht. We stayed at The Andaz in Prinsengracht so we experienced it 3 straight days. Nice , quiet and romantic. Best location for a vacation in Amsterdam in my opinion. Beautiful canal surrounded by lovely houses and buildings .I really love it.

Prinsengracht nice canal & close to Museums. We actually stayed @ a Hotel on this canal . I think the other 2 canals are similar & all are considered to be central (Centrum) city & walking distance to both Museums etc. & other down city attractions. The tram lines run continually up & down (#24 & 16) from the Central Station , so its easy to get on & off-just have the correct euro coins so we didn't take the "Hop on /off bus).Plenty of nice cafes & places to drink ("etc"!.)!Watch out for thezillions bicycles!! They RULE & have the right of way in Amsterdam!Wish we had done a canal tour-was very warm when we went-but had a great time!!!

Beautiful Canal. The only way to see Amsterdam is to stroll along the beutiful canals. Lovely architecture, lots of bars and cafes along the route - and you won't get lost as in Venice. Just watch out for the bikes as on the cycle paths they have right of way, and it is very easy to forget the cycle paths are there.

Gay Pride Parade!!!. We were in Amsterdam on the weekend of the Gay Pride Parade which goes on boats around Princengracht. I have never ever in my life seen so many people and such a bit party - it was fantastic!Boats everywhere, people everywhere. It is such a picturesque canal, and the atmosphere was sensational. Get along and have a look, and if you can, on gay pride weekend. Loads of fun!

Peaceful surroundings!. Very peaceful place, as is most of Amsterdam that we experienced! Picture perfect views, especially on a sunny day! Plenty of cafes. Close to a stop with the hop on hop off tour and of course, the famous Anne Frank Museum. Very busy museum, the line was an hour and a half wait but worth it in the end! Beautiful. Would love to go back!

Nice but overrated. Amsterdam has some nice canals, but overall the city is a bit overrated. Largely spoilt by the seedy aspect and the cafés. Having said that, the canal boat rides are pleasant and it's worth seeing the nicer parts of the city.

Just go for a wander. Prinsengracht and its neighbours Keisergracht and Herrengracht are amongst the nicest avenues in the city, and well worth a prolonged stroll. You'll find a wide range of shops and cafés, but also lots of hidden-away little-known galleries, institutes with open libraries, and other attractions. Each side street opens up into more bars and cafés and sometimes considerably more including some of the more famous attractions and squares.
Amazing view!. Most amazing atmosphere - absolutely gorgeous. Canal lined with trees and houses gives a sense of serenity....peaceful as there are hardly any cars in Amsterdam.
Relaxing. Another fine canal to stroll along taking in the architecture, canals, bridges little shops and stop off for a drink at one of the many cafes.

Great canal with lovely cafes lined all along. We visited Prinsengracht whilst touring Amsterdam one Saturday, loved the look and feel of the place with small cafes lining the water and passed by a couple of markets. There were quite a few good restaurants along the path and a few attractions nearby such as Anne Frank's house.
Good for attractions. Anne Frank Museum is here and also the Tulip and Cheese Museum. Lots of nice Restuarant's in this area and a good place to take a canal tour.
Very attractive. Try visiting it from the Westermarkt to the Browersgracht. Very interesting areas and sites all along, including the many house boats, and less touristy than the Leidsestraat area.

Lovely but ruined with rubbish. It is lovely to have lunch in one of the small cafe's or bars here and the view down the river is beautiful. However the fact it is filthy with plastic bottles and rubbish in it really lets it down.

Grand. Prinsengracht is a stately canal in the inner ring of Amsterdam, and one of the oldest canals. Because it is central, there are many grand houses, restaurants and much life to be seen there. It is also the location of Amsterdam's most famous museum for its most famous daughter, Anne Frank, and queues stream fro the building day and night.

My favourite canal. Very pretty street and canal. Lots of restaurants to visit, from inexpensive coffee shops to classy spot all along the canal. Come here to explore some of the side streets, ride a bike and take pictures.

frozen canals. We were here when the canals actually froze over, it was amazing to ice skate along them! Apparently, it is a rare sight to see. Will be returning when I can go on a canal boat, hopefully at a time of year when the sun shines bright!
The nicest canal & area within Amsterdam. Densely packed houseboats, Westerkerk and many lovely cafes. It is the most charm area : part of Jordaan district and so called the Western canal ring.
Nice street. What could be bad? it's a charming street along a canal. Lots of shops to stop into. Really nothing negative about it.

Beautiful Scenery. We really enjoyed walking along the Prinsengracht, it has slightly less traffic that many of the other canals, making it better for casual strolling. There are lot of different types of architecture along the canal, a tulip market and other attractions. Dotted along the canal are lots of charming cafés, restaurants and attractions.

Different views at every turn. Each canal has it's own personality and even that changes at every turn. Prinsengracht goes by the Westekirk, Anne Frank House, and Amsterdam Tulip Museum. Plenty of cafes with canal side sitting, various shops, etc. It is always good to stroll along and see what's happening.
I love this city. Walking this city is always one of my most favorite things to do. This area is a must as are all others... Loooovvveee Amsterdam!

Quirky and lots to do. What a great canal. It seems crammed with lovely little restaurats, pubs, and even a couple of "coffee" shops. There are also art galleries, smaller shops, ordinary people eating their dinner, canal boats going by, delightful house boats. It's great!

A Beautiful Area of Amsterdam. We were lucky enough to stay in a hotel located on this canal and it was perfect. The neighborhood had so much to offer. It is very centrally located, but yet not too close to Dam Square or the Red Light District. I would highly recommend visiting those areas but not necessarily locating your hotel near those attractions. The Prinsengracht canal, its bridges and the streets & parkways paved with bricks, were fairytale-like! There are great restaurants & bars with lovely seating areas along the canal and shops to enjoy throughout this area. Just remember, as you enjoy this beautiful area, always keep a look out for bikes, cars, motorcycles, open stairwells on the sidewalk, etc., etc., etc. One must always keep alert when in this area on a beautiful summer day when everyone heads to this area! Enjoy!!

Love the updated road work!. I know the locals have to tolerate the road repairs however this traveling couple found it manageable! We understand it is important for the lovely local businesses to be accessable and since my husband is completely blind the maintenance workers were very helpful. This is our favorite Canal and brick road area!

Rent a bike and be happy!. Best way to know it would be by renting a bike and cycling during a entire morning. If you do that early in the morning (around 9) you will probably face less "packed" streets.
Just hire a boat or walk along the canal side. It worth the time.. One of the prettiest place I've ever seen in my life. Just go and walk along it while enjoying the view! Gotta love Amsterdam!
Prinsengracht is worth a stroll. The Jordaan is a great part of Amsterdam--and walking by the Prinsengracht is a great way to take it in.
Wonderful view. We love all of the canals, but Prinsegraght has probably the best views. It ruly captures the spirit of Amsterdam.
Beautiful. Rent bikes or just walk--astoundingly pretty views and the lack of traffic is simply unbelievable if one is used to big, congested cities like New York or London.

Enjoyed the scenic beauty. A very beautiful canal in Amsterdam with a classic touch of homes and shops around. You can take a short walk around or you may hire a boat to see the canal its really one of its kind very soothing and serene. I bet you will definitely enjoy the moments spent there.

Cute neighborhood stroll. Very attractive neighborhood to windowshop and peoplewatch. We were stymied by a long line at the Anne Frank museum so decided to spend a few hours walking and this quaint area q=was perfect for that.
A must-see. One of the three core canals, with classic Amsterdam houses. Make sure to take a walk, or take a boat, or rent a bike and drive around.

Favorite area of Amsterdam. Prinsengract is a lovely area - the canals and houses are particularly nice. It's easy to travel around by foot or tram. The are many lovely restaurants here - especially 'The Pancake Bakery' as well as important sites like the Anne Frank House and some nice churches to look at.

Beautiful place to stay and stroll. We stayed right on this lovely street and canal. We walked up and down at all hours of the day and into the late evening. It is beautiful and lined with cafes and interesting sights along the way.

Lovely canal area!. Stayed four nights in the Pulitzer Hotel on Prinsengracht. Beautiful area of Amsterdam. We enjoyed strolling up and down the canal. Quiet, lovely area but watch for the bikers! They are everywhere and will run you over! Would definitely stay in this area again. Great photo ops and nice places to sit and people watch.

One of the most beautiful canals in Amsterdam.. The Anne Frank museum is on this street/canal. Many other fantastic shops and eating places along the street/canal. A hop on hop off canal boat rides one block down from the Anne Frank house and museum. Very easy walk to catch this tour of the canals. Lovely city. Be sure an take a canal boat tour. Many canal boat tours to select from.
Upgrading in Amsterdam. They are busy upgrading the walkway. We had to take a detour to get to the hotel with our luggage! In the area near Leijdse Plein you find nice restaurants!
Charming Amsterdam. To really appreciate the beauty of Amsterdam, you must go for a walk along Prinsengracht. It's wonderfully romantic and charming!

Love to walk past the water and look at the buildings and people.. The best part of Amsterdam are the grachten (waters) and the walks you can do there. But be careful with the bikers! Bikers have taken over Amsterdam :)

Lovely place to stroll and take in the sights. One of the best canals in the heart of Amsterdam with a wide range of hotels, bars and restaurants. Peaceful and upmarket- the perfect place to stay for a luxury trip

Take a stroll and relax. Really beautiful for a stroll. Nice houses, houseboats and lots of restaurants where you can grab a drink and watch people or boats go by the canal. Very relaxing for any tourist!

one of the main Canals in Amsterdam. If you ever get lost in Amsterdam, just find this canal and follow it around back to the centre. A bike ride or walk down Prinsengracht will lead to so many shops, cafe's, museums and other attractions like the Anne Frank house, that it makes sense to just promenade down this one.
jordan. most beuatiful area in amsterdam.cute shops,bars,restuarantsmuch batter the dam area..no sex but a lot of enviroment..

Elegance from a bygone time. When you walk along this canal with its elegant mansions and canal houses lining both sides, be sure to look up to the decorative gables. As you walk along the canal, look up at the buildings on the other side of the canal, some of which identify the original owners' professions and initials, as well as the year the house was built or, in some cases, renovated. I find this so fascinating that I can walk along this canal with binoculars and just look at each building. You can learn a lot about the history of Amsterdam and the trades and professions extant then. by looking at eh architecture of these canal-side homes.

Pretty Canals. Amsterdam has beautiful canals, that's common knowledge. Prisengraacht, or the Prince's Canal is one of the 3 major canals that circle the heart of Amsterdam. Prinsengraacht is always lively and picturesque. Some of the best postcard views of Amsterdam can be enjoyed here.

Lovely walk. Prinsengracht canal is a beautiful canal with lovely old canal homes on either Sid and some interesting houseboats along side. It is a nice stroll and there are some spots for coffee but not too many. Nice and quiet.
Garden visits. Visited grand canal house gardens which were lovely. (Open once a year and worth finding). The whole area is tranquil and beautiful.

Prinsengracht: Pretty Amsterdam canal photo opportunities. It felt that the Amsterdam canals and the houses that line them did not vary much from "'gracht to gracht", being all pretty with lots of opportunities for photos. Spent most of the time strolling in the central and western ring areas. In Prinsengracht, found a stretch of similar looking houses that were clear of trees in front (this turned out to be the Red Deer Brewery), plus there were also boathouses here, a few of which are open to travelers for a small fee. Of course there are many cafes and restaurants lining this canal (though preferred going into adjacent Jordaan neighbourhood) but the benches are fine for sitting and whiling away the time too, if you don't mind the parked cars behind you.In the western canal ring side, the major attraction is the Anne Frank House which can be easily spotted by the long queue outside the building. Nearby, Westerkerk is also along the Prinsengracht and its Tower can be visited however only allows a limited number of visitors per day it seems. Behind Westerkerk is The Homomonument which is an easy 2-5 minute look-see; it is located along the next main canal Emperor's Canal/Keizersgracht and can provide a turning point for strolling to other areas of the Grachtengordel.

Great place for a stroll in Amsterdam. Prinsengracht canal is a great place to get a real taste of life in Amsterdam . Stroll the canal shop or enjoy the boats going along or simply enjoy a meal or drink at the many cafe's. this is Amsterdam at it's best.
Great Magical building!. It is wonderful for music with a fantastic sound! I went with friends and family everyone old and young enjoyed the experience. I would recommend it to everyone!
Great for a stroll. A walk along the Prinsengracht will take you along the row of many town houses. The Prinsengracht includes many very nice restaurants and brown cafes. Well worth a visit.

One of Three Major "Belt-way" Canals. See it!. Seeing the canals of Amsterdam is, to me, an essential part of a visit to the city. The Prinsengracht (Prince's Canal) is the longest, outer canal of the 17th century major canals in Amsterdam. The other two are Herengracht (Patricians' Canal or Gentlemen's Canal) and Keizersgracht (Emperor's canal). It is named after the Prince of Orange. Most of the canal houses along it were built during the Dutch Golden Age of the United Provinces. This canal was largely used for warehouses. The bridges over the Prinsengracht canal do not connect with the streets in the Jordaan.If you travel around Amsterdam very much, it is hard to avoid encountering this large canal. It is a bit hard to tell one canal from the other, having a map and giving it a look before traveling the city is probably a good idea. This canal can be seen by various means, one of the canal boat tours may be the easiest.

I wish there were 36 hours in a day in Amsterdam.. Prinsengracht (The Prince's Canal), became our central location in this amazing city. I took a picture of Sherri and you'd swear it was a postcard- bikes all over, a beautiful church in the background, and boats in the canal. Grab lunch here in one of the many eateries, stroll hand in hand, or take the canal tour, you can't go wrong. It is hard to say which canal is the best, but we seemed to always gravitate back to this one.

Just strolling - in awe of our surrounds. This is really a stately Amsterdam canal. The typical richman's homes facing the canal have elaborate facings, large windows and interesting entrance doors. During the golden ages the rich merchants lived here, and they really exhibited their wealth. Just be careful whilst strolling along the canals, it is easy to walk into a bike-rider or even.... fall into the canal [yes- it happens] We enjoyed our strolls here as it generally is quiet and peaceful. [greg&jill Australia]

A wonderful walk. On our two days in Amsterdam, we walked Prinsengracht from the Train Station to the Museum on both days and if would have done it the third day as well if we were there. The walk is so peaceful because of the canals and the beautiful architecture along the way. If you want to look away from that for a moment, you can take in the sights and sounds of one of the most vibrant cities in the world or just sit in a cafe and take it all in from there. One of our favourite things to do
Beautiful. one of many wonderful canals, delightful to stroll along and enjoy the variety of cafes, bars and boutique shops, as well as the peaceful atmosphere

All the canals are just as nice. The fours canals including Prinsengracht are just as beautiful until I cannot really tell them apart. The canals defines Amsterdam and day time and night time have totally different views altogether. Great area for people watching (especially those on bicycles) and street photography.
Remember to say hi to those on the boats!
